links_reviews_text: I loved this dress. It was so comfortable and flattering, and the sleeves were actually long enough for my super long arms (exciting!). Only complaint was that it was a smidge short for work (I'm 5'8), but in a less conservative office it would be just fine.

links_reviews_title: So cute, but shorter than expected
links_reviews_text: I rented this to wear for work and it was so cute and I loved the color blocking, but it was much too short. I ended up wearing it to a concert with converse and it looked great, but it runs pretty short

Great fabric on this dress - thin but not see-through, almost silky. Dress is a little shorter than expected, but still work appropriate for me at 5'5. Other reviews mentioned the stripes fit weird, but I did not find that to be true for me. Got quite a few compliments on this one.
Such a lovely fall dress. Fitted top with a bottom that flows

Something about the styling of this dress made me feel like an ice skater; I think it was the color-blocked stripes. On my petite frame, I felt like the proportions were off and wasn't as flattering even though the dress itself fit fine. On the model, it seems to hit mid-thigh and for me, the length was closer to the knee.

This dress looks SO tiny on the hanger but once I put it on it fit well. Was a little too short/tight in the bust for me to wear to work or out to dinner with my bf's parents. I would rent again but get a medium. For reference I am 5'7'', 126lbs and a 34A bust.
Relatively thin but nice fabric and fit well. I wore it with hose and boots and it was great for transitional weather
Fit was perfect. Felt good in the dress at work all day.
Very cute, but stretches out/wrinkles during the work day. True to size but has tons of stretch. I'd size down personally.
Cute comfy! Perfect work dress. Good quality!

links_reviews_title: Very cute but the dress is extremely short
links_reviews_text: I'm a size 4 and rented the Small. When it first came in the mail I thought there was no way I could wear this, it looked extremely small. However it's very stretchy and the fit was perfect! However the dress is VERY VERY short. Almost like a tunic but not quite. I had to wear leggings not regular tights just in case. I would give it 5 stars if the length was longer.

links_reviews_title: One of my favorite rentals so far.
links_reviews_text: This dress fits so well. It's extremely flattering, not too tight. Rented it for work and would love to keep it.
I wore this with tights and black flats and it was so comfortable and felt so flattering. It definitely excentuated what I wanted and hid what I wanted! I would rent this again

wore this as a tunic w leggings because there is no way this cld work with tights. it stopped right after my bum and is flared out so i'm sure if i'm walking around quickly i cld easily flash someone. no biggie though, just wore as a tunic and it was fine. cute color block. very comfy, not itchy. i did find it impossible to wear a bra that didn't show lies though because even though it's knit, it's quite thin so i can't find anything that doesn't show lines, which is my pet peeve. no bra doesn't work either.

This dress was very flattering on me. I have smaller chest and pear shape. The material is on the thin side, but it was high quality (did not show undergarment lines - that is KEY). Very comfortable and fun to wear. Good for casual Friday.
I was happy with the fit and length. It looked cute with black tights and ankle boots
Loved this dress! Wore with black tights and black over the knee boots to dinner with friends. Will definitely rent again!!

I ultimately did not wear this. I was surprised that this one wasn't more flattering. I think it's a combination of the lighter colorblock on top, in contrast with the black on bottom, and the downward triangle pattern that caused my shoulders to look extra wide - an unflattering look for me. Material is light and the skirt part is quite short. Would probably have worn with tights or knee high boots in this colder weather.

links_reviews_title: cute and comfy, but stripes hit in weird places
links_reviews_text: This dress originally does NOT look like a medium when look at it, but it's made of a really comfy and stretchy material that doesn't get sheer when you put it on. It's really cute, but as someone who is rather busty, the transition from the pink to the navy hit right in the middle of my chest and made everything look very angular and strange. However, my friend who has a more straight body tried it on and it looked great on them! It's a beautiful and flattering dress for people who aren't busty on top.

links_reviews_title: I wanted to love this but the fit was just not right.
links_reviews_text: Pros: brand new. Gorgeous fabric. Cons: the dress fit horribly on my body. The stripes in the front hit lower than in the back, which mad my chest look extremely awkward. Also make an expensive dress look cheap. I also thought it was too short and flouncy in the back. Wish it would have been snugger and longer through the body.

I loved this coat and will buy fur sure once the price reduces!!! I wore this for rain and mid 50's-60's temperature. It's got a nice adjustable fit in waistline so you can adapt as needed. The colors are vibrant and easy to match. I got sooooooo many compliments. I wore this easily 20 times!!!

Took this on a tropical vacation and it was perfect. Did a great job protecting me from the rain, pockets were great with the zip shut option, and I loved that the hood could be zipped in to make a jacket with a normal collar when you didn't need the hood. Such a fun look and perfect for my central American trip.

More of a windbreaker than a rain jacket (definitely was not waterproof), but it's so beautiful I didn't care. Runs a little large but the waist can be cinched. If it weren't so expensive, I would have kept it...

Found this in the NYC store, with the tags on, during a recent summer downpour. RTR totally saved the day and this jacket is adorable, and kept me dry. Has nice gold zipper accents and zip close pockets which is super handy. Fits oversize like a typical raincoat probably could have made a 4-10 work just fine. Rolled up hood which hides away in a zipper, this jacket will be a staple for any rainy weather or trips I take in the future.

links_reviews_title: Was great for a spring themed gala
links_reviews_text: Loved this!

links_reviews_title: Beautiful fabric and details, small in the arms.
links_reviews_text: A bit tight for what should be a roomy size. I was able to get it on over a t shirt, but a cardigan under it was uncomfortable. The fabric was absolutely gorgeous though, and nice quality construction.

links_reviews_title: Playful jacket for a gray rainy day.
links_reviews_text: Pros, vibrant colors but not an eyesore. Classy detailing and quality hardware. No cons.

links_reviews_title: Fun statement jacket for everyday wear
links_reviews_text: Cute design and cute oversized fit. It's a raincoat technically but I wore it in Los Angeles summer in the evenings and it was great. Very cute over jeans or a plain dress with sneakers.
Lovely, warm and light

links_reviews_title: Fun, lightweight jacket great for all occasions!
links_reviews_text: Just a really fun jacket that can be worn rain or shine. Lightweight, loved the print and minimal zippers/pulls.
Maybe slight small, but this is the cutest rain coat of all time. I'm finding myself wishing it would rain so I could wear it

I rented this for a music festival on a day that I knew would rain. It's such a fun coat and is definitely very waterproof! I was easy to find in the crowd and it was nice to combat the dreary weather with the fun pattern! Definitely not something I would buy but the perfect rental piece!

links_reviews_title: Cool print for a jacket. Lightweight and fun for summer nights.
links_reviews_text: I got several compliments on the jacket. The wrists were a bit snug on me personally.

links_reviews_title: Cute but beware of open spaces between buttons
links_reviews_text: Shows a lot of skin when sitting down in between buttons! Otherwise super cute

I rented this for a summer work day. The dress is a bit short at its highest point. Material is thin and loose threads are showing signs of wear. I'm usually a 2 or a 4. I would have ordered the 4 but it wasn't available. At first I thought the 2 was pulling across the chest, but it ended up being fine. The color and cut were still fun though. Got compliments.
This dress is so flattering and the material is really light, also a little thin but not see through. Would rent this dress again!!

This is the second time I rented this dress. The size 2 was too tight and the size 4 fit better except the sleeves were slightly too long. No biggie though. Loved the lightweight material and asymmetrical ruffled hem. Perfect for hot summer days!

I rented this for a work dinner and absolutely loved the color and the cut on this dress. I expected it to be a little shorter and it was a little loose around the waist and arms, but I am going to give it the benefit of the doubt and assume that's is the intended fit. I wore it an additional time with white canvas sneakers and it worked perfectly as well. Will definitely rent this again.
Oh man! I loved this dress. The print was cool, the material felt like a nice seersucker (so, very light, better for warm weather). The real showstopper was the asymmetrical hemline. So fun

links_reviews_title: Beautiful color and design, should have sized up.
links_reviews_text: Maybe in the bigger size would have been better. But as is was tight in the bust and I had to pin it. Sleeves strangely long. I liked the fabric and vibrant blue color and the ruffle.
I could of gone down one size. Got a 4 but should of gotten a 2. I'm 5'0 and pretty petite. It was a cute baggy dress.

The blue color is so pretty and the dress design is really fun and flattering. For some reason the asymmetrical hem felt like it made the skirt a little short, but it wasn't inappropriately short to wear to work or anything. I got a lot of compliments on it! I dressed it down with sneakers for work, but it could easily be dressed up with heels!

links_reviews_title: Wore with tights for dinner with the girls!
links_reviews_text: I am pear shaped and would not have felt comfortable wearing this as a dress. I paired it with tights and I loved this look! The material is light weight with a bit of stretch.

This dress is very fun, but the buttons are not good if you have an average-large chest or hips-- they open often. I wore a 4 and it fit rather snuggly. I got a lot of compliments on it, and the white buttons are super cute. The material is a little weird and shows sweat badly/ and wrinkles easy.

I have an hourglass shape and this dress is a bit boxy. Added a belt to define my waist. The chest is a little tight. I wear a size up because I'm a 36D but still the buttons kept popping. Tape is recommended.
Good for work although the chest area was a little small so it kept spreading (make sure to wear something underneath).

links_reviews_title: Got a lot of compliments on this dress while i wore it to work. Felt bougie wearing a dress at $495
links_reviews_text: Pros: like the style of the dress and the comfort of it. The material is nice and silky and very lightweight. Paired it with a leather jacket and white flats to go with the look. Cons: could have sized down to a 2 and be more form fitting. Bc it was a bit loose i felt like maybe the dress have stretched out from the previous owner. Overall.. prob won't rent this dress again. I didn't love it... Thank you, next. (Ariana grande)

I love this edgy dress by Derek Lam 10 Crosby! Running true to size with no stretch, I recommend wearing your true size for your primary size and going up for your back up. This style is fitted throughout the midsection and fitted at the hips. It works for all cup sizes. You are able to wear a standard bra with this dress. At 5’6”, the length hit mid-thigh on me; but the entire hem is high-low. The pattern on the dress is amazing in person and the buttoned sleeves add a nice touch. Pair with nude heels, sneakers and fun earrings to complete your outfit!

links_reviews_title: LOVE the print and cut of dress.
links_reviews_text: I got a ton of compliments on this dress. Cute style. Love the asymmetrical hem. It's not too much. Very flattering. Not too short. Light silky fabric. Doesn't wrinkle too much. I'm usually between a size 2 and 4. Wore the 4 and it was perfect fit. I do recommend wearing double stick tape between the buttons where your chest is largest. It kept gaping open. If not so expensive, I would definitely buy this.

The fabric is lovely but I think this may be better for slim less curvy body types. The space between the buttons kept gapping. To avoid further embarrassing moments I had to double side tape the space between the first and last buttons.
Loved the fabric, color, and style but it was incredibly short on me.
The dress itself was so cute and I got a ton of complements. However, I was uncomfortable all day. The front kept riding up due to how thin the material was.
True to size. cute flouncy hem
I sized up per reviews but this was still way too small -- too short in the front for work.
Size up if you want it more work appropriate. It was more form fitted than expected and tight around my bust. Gorgeous piece!
Not flattering, super boring

links_reviews_title: I only wore it once. It was cute, but it did not look amazing on me.
links_reviews_text: I struggled on what shows to wear with it. Material is very clingy.

links_reviews_title: Clings in all the wrong places.
links_reviews_text: This dress is guaranteed to start a pregnancy rumor. Bc the seam on the ruffle at the bottom is tight and smaller than the width of the dress, it kind of pulls the bottom down and in. I'm in shape without much of a gut, this shaped around the small pudge I do have have made me look pregnant.
Fabric did not hang well. Did not wear.
Holy smokes if I wore this to work my crotch would have fallen out. I'm only 5'0 so I have no idea who this dress was designed for. Save this for weekend wear, NOT work

PROS: beautiful blue color with interesting print. Pairs well with black or neutral. The silk is very thin and as a result, drapes well. Well constructed and quite elegant. CONS: clingy fabric. I felt very self conscious about it and was constantly adjusting the dress. Chest is tight! I'm a C cup and had to wear something under the dress due to gap and just being too close of a fit. In retrospect, I would probably get a 10 and just plan to layer something underneath. The sleeves are also really long. I have longer arms so fine with me. Finally, the dress is just above the knee for me.
Got soooo many compliments on this. Beautiful color and fit. Super flattering and fun. I'm 5'10 so I wore it as a tunic with leggings.

links_reviews_title: Way too thin and completely clingy.
links_reviews_text: The fabric was way too thin to be considered a dress you'd see everything through it. Plus the static cling was so bad it clung to every single inch of my skin. Didn't wear.

It can look a bit "little house on the prairie"-ish but overall I think it was really cute. I was worried it would be too tight around my hips but it fit perfectly. It's pretty light so I wore a thin long sleeve shirt and thin leggings underneath for the winter. Very cute for everyday!
Material is very thin and clingy.

links_reviews_title: Beautiful, thin fabric, fit everywhere but the bust.
links_reviews_text: Too small in the bust - couldn't wear it.
Great dress, but the sleeves were way too long on me.
Very stylish dress, but doesn't look good on me

links_reviews_title: Super flattering, and didn't fit as loose/boxy as I thought by other women's photos
links_reviews_text: Great length for my height and was a super flattering fit.
Weird button pouch formed at the bottom of the dress. Otherwise great dress
Too tight on chest
Ran too small in the bust. Didn't wear.
Wore this dress for work, it was super comfy and very lightweight. Material was very soft, definitely ran true to size.
Wore this on vacation to San Francisco. It was comfortable and super cute. Only negative would be that the sweater is short.
This sweater was perfect for staying warm and also being stylish on my Portland coast vacay!
This cute sweater was perfect with high waisted jeans, super warm for my cold cold office. Only complaint was that it was itchy, you have to wear with an undershirt.
I'm 5'5, 127lbs. This fits great. Warm cozy and fashionable. I wear it to work and out to dinner.
Really liked this casual top. Could have dressed up with black pants for work or casual weekend. Material isn't the softest but not uncomfortable. On the shorter side but super cute! Would rent again

I really like this sweater, the sleeves are so much fun. It is a little more cropped than I expected, but it looks great with high waisted jeans. It's very warm, heavy, and is very high quality. Definitely recommend!
I wore high waisted pants and they were still a little to short for the sweater. Love the side detail. This is a no fail sweater. Really can't go wrong.

My boyfriend called this my fancy Snuggie, and I'd agree. I travel weekly and this became my go-to plane sweater. It's warm and comfortable but looks chic enough to wear at the office if it's cold. I'm petite so it wasn't too short.

Absolutely loved this sweater! I'm 5'9" so it was a little short on me, which is why I wore it with high-waisted leggings. However, the sleeves were a perfect length for someone of my height. Got a ton of compliments, too!

links_reviews_title: Okay I will buy it. Because OBSESSED!
links_reviews_text: This is just one of the most flattering crop sweatshirts I've ever seen! Love love love !!
This sweater is beautiful! Sits at waist. Sleeves are baggy but don't hang so low it drags through plates and stuff. Super flattering, wore with blue jeans and read heels.

links_reviews_title: Looks great, not the most comfortable
links_reviews_text: I loved the way this looked but I wish it were more comfortable -- it is itchier than the reviews stated so I had to wear a shirt underneath it. I probably wouldn't rent again because of the comfort factor.

links_reviews_title: Wore multiple times with high waisted pants to work -- soooo cute! Thinking about buying this one!!
links_reviews_text: perfect fit. not too baggy, not too tight

links_reviews_title: Got compliments on it every time I wore it.
links_reviews_text: Gorgeous fit. Thick material, might feel itchy sometimes. Overall great.

I can't believe how warm and cozy this sweater is. At first, I wasn't so sure because the sides of the sleeves are open, so you do get wafts of cold air through them. But the rest of the sweater is SO warm! It was snowing with a wintry mix out in NYC today, and I was super warm with just that and my winter coat. I was warm and toasty at work too. It definitely needs to be paired with high-waisted pants though, because it is cropped. It's not overly short like most cropped tops though. I also love the turtleneck - it's loose and does not bother me like most turtlenecks do. I would totally keep this sweater if it were just a little bit cheaper!

I am sucker for a statement sleeve, but these were a bit clunky. Also found the turtleneck a bit too thick and overall the sweatshirt could have been softer. I have a pretty short torso and would have liked this to be a little longed, so keep that in mind if you're longer in the middle. Fun to wear once but not something I'd rent again.
Easy do a cold day but not really any wow factor

links_reviews_title: Love this! Wore it several times
links_reviews_text: Dressed this up and down. Can really wear this anywhere and it was super comfy. Will rent again for sure!!
Wish the weight of fabric wasn't so heavy otherwise would of purchased. But great body style.
Wow I lived in this sweater in the lovely 40 degree Spring weather of Boston. So comfortable. Perfect cut for high waisted jeans.

The fit is great however it is a heavy fabric which tends to be a little hot (I wore it in May it may have been a tad hot outside as well). I loved the look and fit but it arrived with an iron burn of which I didn't notice until I was outside. Regardless, I still received many compliments. It is very flattering when worn with boots and slim pants or dress it up with heels and skirt.
It fit perfectly, I got lots of compliments. When I went to wash my hands, the sleeve to get wet. But that's no big deal.
Would say it’s a little more structured and sits higher on the abdomen than the picture. Overall nice. Very warm

links_reviews_title: Sleeves were the standout to this sweater
links_reviews_text: Fit well, was expecting it to be softer though
Fit really well but be aware it's not that long. Really amazing top!
Very very heavy material. Cropped looked amazing with high waisted pants.
Loved it! Hugely flattering. Wore it to work and to relax, compliments every time.

This is a cute piece. The material is not a sweatshirt OR a sweater. So, it's not as comfortable as I imagined when I rented it. It's thick and a little inflexible. Aside from this, it's a cute and flattering top.

links_reviews_title: This was really cropped- but may be because I have a larger chest- loved the sleeves.
links_reviews_text: The waist hit about 3 inches above my belly button which was not at all what I expected from the photo. The fabric was also REALLY stiff- not like the description of sweatshirt apparel.
It was roomy without looking too bulky. I really liked this top and if it weren't so distinctive would've kept it longer to wear more.
Flattering
Very large top and billowing arms -not my style

links_reviews_title: Perfect for a winter's night out!
links_reviews_text: I wore this with jeans and a longer tank (it's a bit cropped) for a night out. It was chilly, but this sweater/sweatshirt is substantial enough that I didn't even need a jacket. That's a good thing, since the really memorable. unique sleeves would be hard to stuff into coat sleeves. LOVED IT!

links_reviews_title: So sad it's a crop top!
links_reviews_text: I was most excited about this in my box, but was so disappointed when I took it out of the package. I immediately saw that this is a short, cropped too. Everyone was raving about the sleeves, which is why I picked it. Unfortunately, while the sleeves are adorable, the bottom of the sweater barely hits my belly button. I wanted this for a weekend away in a VERY cold climate, so a cropped style wasn't going to fly. Wish it was just a little longer so I could've wore it this weekend away with the girls!
Wanted to wear it for work but too itchy
I got so many compliments on this sweater. I wore it with a pencil skirt and boots.

links_reviews_title: Got so many complements on it!
links_reviews_text: Such a cute take on a regular sweatshirt. Got complements from complete strangers! Very thick warm material - perfect for winter.
Sleeves kinda get in the way but its worth it to be extra

Excellent quality material - somewhat structured, but not stiff. This does run short in the torso, but I wore with a long tank top underneath and had no problems. Sleeves are voluminous, but somehow not really in the way. Considered buying and will definitely rent again!
I loved the way this top fit. Very comfortable and stylish!

links_reviews_title: A shirt that makes an outfit!
links_reviews_text: This is the cutest plaid shirt that can make an outfit with both jeans or more dressed up pants and skirts. I received lots of compliments. It's short but the peplum makes it flattering. I was worried about the sleeves being tight but it worked just fine on my athletic arms. I want it!

links_reviews_title: Cute little top for the office!
links_reviews_text: This shirt is on the shorter side if you are tall. Loved the plaid fabric.

Such a fun plaid top with beautiful details in the back and on the neckline. I especially like the pearl buttons. I typically wear a S in tops, sometimes a M and used the number conversion guide to choose a size for this; the M is a perfect fit. Wore this one multiple times (dinner out, work, a casual evening event) and got compliments on the bright, beautiful purple color. Paired with dark denim.
Fit fine - just a touch too short for my liking.
Love the color and fit! More vibrant in person.

This top fit me very well. Nice fabric. Cool openness and buttons down the back. It's fashion forward and the colors are fun and unique. It went with a lot of things I own but looked especially great with jeans and some orang-y pants I have. I will probably rent again.
Wrinkles easy
This peplum is super flattering and I love the color. I wore it on a date with jeans and black boots and my date said he liked my outfit.
Crotch was too low; baggy fit. Back tie was too loose. Not sure I would have liked it even if it fit. The white buttons made me feel like I was wearing a kid's romper
Super cute jumper but runs long in the torso which makes it not as comfy for all day use. Loved bopping around Austin in it!

Super cute and fun to wear! I'm usually a small but rented a medium for a looser fit. I had to steam it before wearing and it did wrinkle pretty easily. I wore it for an axe throwing birthday party with leopard print Vans. Got lots of compliments. It's hard to hide you back bra strap with the tie. Overall fun and comfy to wear!

links_reviews_title: Shut the front door I LOVE this
links_reviews_text: I put this on and fell in love, no question. It is FUN to wear. I came VERY close to buying this brand new with the tag on. The ONLY thing I wish this romper had was pockets. If it had pockets I'm pretty sure I would have shelled out the $ for it. I wore this to work and then out that night with a denim jacket. Of course the biggest drawback with this, and any romper, is that you have to take off your entire outfit to pee. I only wore petals underneath so I felt utterly naked in a bathroom stall. Pretty sure some people saw through those little stall-cracks, but oh well--live free! I cannot stress how much I enjoyed wearing this. I will say this; if you don't like attention, don't rent this romper. I didn't look particularly good or different the day I wore this but believe me when I say that EVERYBODY was looking at me all day. A little boy on the bus in the morning stared at me for 10 minutes straight. Red is a powerful color, folks, wear it wisely. Pictures do not do it justice. It wears a little loose, and the tie in the back is hard to do alone if you don't have someone to tie it for you but I managed. The length came to about my ankles, I'm 5'3 with a long torso. The XS was long enough so I don't think long-torso-people need to size up like with some rompers. It feels pretty free-flowing true-to-size. I ended up wearing this 2 days in a row. I'll definitely rent again and I wholeheartedly recommend you try this fun piece out yourself.

links_reviews_title: Loved it, but a little big in the crotch
links_reviews_text: I absolutely loved this jumper. It's a little long in the crotch, but I made it work. It's also a little long in length, but to be fair, I am only 5'3". I ordered an XS and I'm usually a S and it was still a little loose. No worries though. I was able to eat all the hot dogs and hamburgers! Lovely little red number.

links_reviews_title: Super comfortable and beautiful color - dress it up for day or night!
links_reviews_text: I'm rather petite and the fit and length was perfect where I could wear sandals or short heels. It was super comfortable, I ended up wearing it to a weekend daytime event and then to work. Love it!

I loved this jumpsuit -- super flattering, noticeable but not too wild. I found it big in the crotch and in the elastic waist. It stretched out significantly during the day, which only exacerbated the fit problem. I would rent again for a casual day, though.
It's a little odd to choose a bra because the back is cut open. I am small chested and opted to go without. Aside form that, wasn't too long, was really comfy. Got compliments!
cute jumper! But needed a smaller size. I wore it out with wedges - I'm 5'2 / 125 pounds and this was too long for me and a bit baggy. didn't wear a bra with it because of the open back

links_reviews_title: I got it to wear to my super casual office and got tons of compliments
links_reviews_text: The fit is a bit more snug in the hips, so I'd size up if you have a more hourglass shape! (I am 125 lbs, 5'4)
Super cute romper but the crotch was so low. I wouldn't even necessarily agree with the "long torso" reviews because the waist hit me perfectly.
I had a hard time getting this over my booty, once I did it was super comfortable and cute!

I can never wear rompers since my torso is so long, so I was looking forward to trying this based on other reviews saying this romper had a long torso. That being said, this piece has a super long torso. I think maybe a medium would have worked better, but may have been too tight in the thighs. I ended up not wearing this.

links_reviews_title: Need a long torso to wear
links_reviews_text: This is such a cute jumpsuit, but I'm 5' 5" with a short torso and the crotch was about 5 inches too long.
Really digging this Victorian ML top! I went down a size!

Flattering and got tons of compliments. I think a previous RTR member might have cut off the black velvet ties at the neck though - the shirt I received had super short ties- I was barely able to make a bow. Definitely NOT the look on the model or other reviews. Made it work though and liked the look. Much better tucked in than loose. Wore to work and then holiday party. Perfect for winter work wear.
Loved this blouse with a skirt or with jeans for a more casual look!

links_reviews_title: Fun polished peasant top w/ great details, but boxy if not tucked in
links_reviews_text: Gorgeous top. It's a bit short and wide but not an issue when tucked in. It made the outfit!
Fits great, very sophisticated
I love this shirt! Got so many compliments at work and then happy hour. The sleeves felt a little short to me but that may just be my long arms trying to wear a size small.
Can wear for either work or evening. Great material!

links_reviews_title: Beautiful work or night out top.
links_reviews_text: Loved this!
I really liked this top. Very professional- but so cute. Got plenty of compliments
Blouse fits true to size. Blouse is lined, so it worked perfectly with a nude bra (no show-through). Received a ton of compliments from both men and women. Will def wear again.
Perfect for work
I really loved this too. It was fun yet professional. I normally wear a medium but conservatively ordered a large. It was large! Next time I'll stick with medium (and I do plan to rent this again).
FLOWY. Not see thru.
Beautiful blouse. Wore to a tech conference, got several compliments!
Fit great and has very expensive look and feel. Classic look with modern twist. Felt great and got lots of compliments.
I found this to be dingy in color with a slight odor. Fit was tight. I couldn't even figure out how to tie the neck. Whatever.

links_reviews_title: Arms too short and elastic uncomfortably tight
links_reviews_text: I was so excited when this top was finally available, but I was disappointed. The whole blouse runs a little small, but I could have made it work except the arms were short and the elastic at the wrists was ridiculously tight. Didn't wear it.
I wore this to a meeting I had to attend, and got lots of compliments from everyone. I will definitely be renting it again!
Wore this to work for a presentation and loved it. It fit well but the upper sleeves/shoulders were a tad bit tight on me.
Not very flattering - the v neck was too gaping and the ribbon confusing

links_reviews_title: Looking for a kind of costume-y shirt? Look no further!
links_reviews_text: Fit was TTS. Elastic on the sleeves was pretty tight and the sleeves felt a little short.

links_reviews_title: Volunteered at an event w this
links_reviews_text: Fit comfortable. Stayed warm - inside w high AC. Sleeves bellowed too much so I inverted them in.
There was a lot more fabric than it looked in the photos. I looked like a pirate. Couldn't wear it.

links_reviews_title: Rent for the look, not for the feel
links_reviews_text: A top that receives lots of compliments, though the experience of wearing it wasn't great. The elastics on the sleeves are very tight and leave marks after the day, the hook in the back keeps coming undone and the fabric feels cheap. Overall, I wouldn't rent again but it did look good.

Loved this top! The details are stunning and I got multiple compliments on it. It's fun, flirty but also not too stuffy. I also liked that it wasn't see through, so no need to wear a tank underneath it.
The sleeves are too short. The elastic that is supposed to lay at the wrist, was about 2-3 inches above my wrists.

links_reviews_title: Great statement top with pretty details!
links_reviews_text: This top made for a fun piece of work-wear when I layered a white tank top underneath, as the split neck in the front can be quite revealing. I received many compliments on the shirt and felt very confident in the shirt. The only downside I noticed was related to the sleeves: they were a touch short, and the elastic in the wristbands felt very on my thin arms and wrists. I would likely not wear again for a full work-day because of the discomfort due to the wristbands. For an event or something shorter than 10 hours, I'd give it a whirl again!
I loved the lightweight feminine look. Fit perfectly.

links_reviews_title: Eh glad I tried something new
links_reviews_text: This runs large but randomly the elastic cuffs on the forearm were tight and uncomfortable. I wasn't a huge fan of how the collar didn't totally stick up straight. There are weird ruffles on the back that kind of make you look like a dinosaur or something ha! It's a whole lot of look but I'm glad I tried something new - that's what RTR is for. I felt a little better after I put on a blazer and hid some of the frill. Wouldn't rent again!
Cute shirt. Well made. Back doesn't stay closed, sleeves were a bit short on me, but still worked (I'm tall and my arms are longer).

This top is pretty but more more oversized than I had expected. It's billowy and not able to be tucked in, which was what I wanted to do. Might be cute with a tight leather legging, but did not work for me!

links_reviews_title: Maybe if you have a long torso and smaller chest?
links_reviews_text: Not a good look on me. The last piece I tried on and wanted to work out of my order. It was an utter fail. I think this could work on other body types, just not mine.
It is a lovely blouse for work, party or evening house. Romantic without being too lacy. The white and velvet are a great combination.

I rented this blouse for a family photo shoot. Between the fact that it ran a bit large on me, the lower than expected front slit and the tie/neckline situation, I ended up not wearing it. But it's a beautiful well made blouse for another occasion!

The shirt is really is really pretty. The material is really nice. However, the fit isn't the way I like my shirts to fit. I'm a little busty so straight cut shirts dont flatter me. The shirt made me look bigger than I was.
Love his top. Fit true to size. Just a nice fancy blouse. Can probably be dressed up or down.
So classy and stylish.

links_reviews_title: Tried to wear this with a skirt and pants, but couldn't make it work.
links_reviews_text: There was a lot going on with this top. I like a feminine look, but it had too many ruffles and volume for a petite build. I tried pairing it with a few different bottoms and just couldn't make it work.
Okay, but collar wouldn't stand as shown in image so required consistent adjustment, which was annoying.
Great material and style. Ladylike and classy. Slit at neckline is a bit low-cut.
Medium was too large Small fit perfect. Flattering and love the color.
Cute summer top for work. Peplum hides the muffin top and the stretchy material made my chest look nice and voluptuous. Comfortable easy to wear.
I wore this with jeans to the office on a causal day. I'm sure I will be able to dress it up as well. Fits true to size and is flattering!

links_reviews_title: Cute, but too short for taller ladies
links_reviews_text: This was too short for my taller frame, so the peplum hit at a weird spot in the middle of my torso. Otherwise, quality was good, and the stretch was nice and forgiving.

links_reviews_title: So comfortable! It is versatile and cute with jackets, blazers, cardigans.
links_reviews_text: True to size

links_reviews_title: It's ironic that I wore this so many times and never got a photo of me in it!
links_reviews_text: I was going to order a small but because some of the reviews said that it could be a little bit to cropped I went with the medium. Best decision I ever made. I wore this five times in the month that I had it and got compliments every time. It was so cute with jeans and leggings and with or without a sweater over it. And the color was such a nice change of pace for my all black wardrobe.

links_reviews_title: Cute and worked great with a crop jacket of mine that has off white, denim blue and taupe colors.
links_reviews_text: It is very cute and the peplum style looked really good with a crop jacket I have. Unfortunately, I didn't get to wear it out but I did pull it together with stuff I already had (jeans, jacket with pops of off white, denim blue, rosey/taupe).
Super cute casual top! Rented this for vacation and it was the perfect top with jean shorts and pants! The peplum is super flattering and it was really comfortable as a day time top at our resort!
Has a nice fit, flattering, could dress up or down, the fabric was thick/bumpy enough to help hide bra lines.
The peplum gave this piece a nice touch. the pattern accentuates your chest - if that's your style!

links_reviews_title: Wore it out on a regular weekend.
links_reviews_text: Very comfortable and flattering. Wish I could keep!

links_reviews_title: Nice shirt but runs a bit big
links_reviews_text: The torso is long. Overall nice material but wore for only half a day
Loved the fit, loved the color, loved the material. Wore this to a birthday party and to work. Felt sexy and nice both times. Would love to own this top.

links_reviews_title: Cute, flattering top, great for work
links_reviews_text: This was a nice little top with a lot of stretch and a very forgiving peplum. This would be a great top if you wanted to look nice but not be constrained (thanksgiving dinner with boyfriends family?? Haha). I wore it with black jeans and a black blazer and it was great.

I'm 5'9, 34G bust. Normally wear a medium or large shirt. This was way too short on me; yet the arm holes were way too big and the bust fit was off. I feel like a large would have fit great except for the short length. If you're talk or have a long torso I'd pass on this!

links_reviews_title: Best material and such a flattering fit
links_reviews_text: Loved this tank! Will rent so many more times. A great high quality stretchy material that gives a flattering fit
Very cute and comfortable fabric. Too small though, size up!
Super cute. Flowy and not tight anywhere on the body.
Perfect summer dress for a sassy celebration
Super fun dress, amazing stitch work
Obsessed with the embroidered flowers and shape. Buttons are a little too small for the holes and sometimes come undone.

Something is terribly wrong with the buttons on this dress. Although it was the correct size for me the buttons are a fabric crochet style and refused to stay closed. I wore this to a pool party "luau" theme and it was fine if my bathing suit was exposed a few times, but I'd never to be able to wear this to dinner without button malfunctions.

I could feel the heads turning when I wore this dress. I Loved this dress, it's casual but still very unique and cute. The embroidery is gorgeous. I Was pleasantly surprised when I found out it was lined, so you don't have to worry about the linen being see through. So glad I DIDN'T listen to the reviews saying this ran big, because in my case if did not. The medium is my normal size and it fit me very well. If I had done the small I there is no way I would have been able to button the top buttons. The Critique I have to share is about the buttons. The buttons are so cute, but They are not very functional. The only downside to this dress is sometimes the buttons come undone, I think it has a lot to do with the fact that the buttons are crouched and the button holes are large. So rent this dress bc it's cute just make sure you have a bestie or a man near by to help l you manage your buttons
This dress is gorgeous in person. Runs small In chest area. So many compliments. Felt like a doll!

this dress was perfect for my México City trip! The colors and embroidery make it a dream dress. My only complaint about this dress was the fabric knit buttons slip undone VERY easily, so watch out for that!

links_reviews_title: This dress is a tasteful work of art
links_reviews_text: I rented for vacation in the Bahamas. I kept the dress an extra week and wore it to Easter service + brunch. If I owned this dress I would wear all the time! The fabric was thicker than expected but still breezy. It buttons all the way up the front so it makes for a very tailored fit! It's a great dress for hourglass shapes or someone a little bustier! The bust + shoulders were a little big on me but I liked the oversized fit. The shape of the dress was so flown and bouncy! The sleeves are a statement and the skirt twirl is perfect for dancing. The. Embroidery is stunning.

links_reviews_title: This dress is gorgeous !!! But runs very small!
links_reviews_text: I'm in between a L/XL but this dress fits like a M!! It's beautiful and not to short but wayy too small I'm so sad that I doesn't fit! ;(

links_reviews_title: Wish they had a bigger size, runs very small =( super sad
links_reviews_text: Wasn't able to wear but super gorgeous and colorful!!! Beautiful embroidery work and comfy fabric

links_reviews_title: So beautiful, but the buttons cause trouble
links_reviews_text: I loved the thick material of this dress, the colors, the cut, the embroidery. What a piece of art! Unfortunately, I had a bit of trouble with the buttons. I don't know if it was because size S ran a bit large for me, but they'd pop open in the worst moments - think grocery shopping when leaning forward to grab bananas. Ugh.
Runs small in the chest area. Didn't get a chance to wear it though it's adorable!

links_reviews_title: Beautiful fabric, runs small in bust
links_reviews_text: This dress is incredibly well-made and a beautiful fabric. It's not lined, but is a fairly thick and sturdy fabric. Honestly seems really great for travel and vacation. Unfortunately for me, it runs a bit small in the bust. I found the medium to fit true to size everywhere except the 3rd button from the top (36c/d). If I'd gone up to the large, the skirt and shoulders likely would have been too big for me.
I posted a photo on my Instagram and everyone messaged me. Very unique and high quality. I sort of want to keep it but it's still pretty expensive at the keep price.
I love this one but a few caveats - I couldn't wear a bra as it had no give at all. It's also very thick material which was great for air conditioned office but very hot outside!

Wanted to love this since the design is so cute, but the fit is really weird. Runs large, but the bust area gaped oddly around the neckline. My friend who wears a size up from me tried it on and found the same problem.

links_reviews_title: Didn't wear as it was so small that all top buttons could not be buttoned up.
links_reviews_text: Did not wear as it did not fit. Material is heavy as flowers are embroidered. Beautiful dress and wish I could wear it tomorrow to work.
To be fair I do have a larger chest, the buttons were able to button but there was a gap in the middle button so I did not wear it. Super cute though!

links_reviews_title: Runs small, cuter than the pictures
links_reviews_text: This dress runs smaller than normal sizing. It is, however, cuter in person than photographed. The blue is like the ocean and the embroidery is lovely. Just wish it was a more comfortable and flirty fit as pictured.

links_reviews_title: Runs small in the chest area and the material felt rough and not high quality.
links_reviews_text: It wont even close. I am a true size 14 and the XL ( recommended by RTR after I used the filter for size 14 , was definitely not a 14). Ladies there is NO STRETCH. So, if you are anything above a regular 10 and small chest, you cannot wear this. The color despite the quality is pretty. Also the dress needs to be ironed, it came in pretty wrinkly.

links_reviews_title: I was close to loving it.
links_reviews_text: It is so promising - the color and the embroidery are perfect. It fit perfectly when I was standing, but when I sat I felt front pulled open a little - like there should have been more overlap in the fabric. And even though mine came new with tags, I thought the button embroidery was already looking worn.

links_reviews_title: Cute pattern and detail, buttons make almost wearable
links_reviews_text: This is a very nice print/color. The embroidery is very nice, mine still had tags, so in great condition. The dress almost became unwearable because the buttons would not stay buttoned. I woke this dress at an Easter party with about 5 safety pins to keep from busting out. The size was pretty close to normal size, and my bust isn't too large- the buttons are embroidered which may be the problem.

links_reviews_title: This is a gorgeous dress. Fabric is great quality. Order your true size. Doesn’t run large.
links_reviews_text: The reviews stated the dress ran large. It does not, order your size. I was not able to wear because I ordered one size small.

A button popped off in the middle of a conversation at the party I wore this too. Not cute. I had to sew it and ask the host for a sew kit. It's a well made dress but the embroidered buttons need to be checked for tightness.

links_reviews_title: Super cute but runs very small!
links_reviews_text: Fit is very strange. I tend to be size 8, a medium in most things, a large when I am nervous about something running small. I rented an XL in this after reading the reviews. This seemed to fit best in the bust/hips, with some weird looseness in the back. The buttons are horrible and come unbuttoned all day. But it's so cute and I received so many compliments! I think I would rent this again.
runs a little big.

This dress was HUGE. I probably would've needed 1-2 sizes smaller. In addition, the arms were very unflattering. A shame because it looked very cute on the hanger and the colors really popped in person! If it fit, it would've been a great dress!
I am a true size Medium (6-8) so I ordered size medium for this dress and it was so big on me, size down

This dress arrived new with tags and is ADORABLE! But unfortunately it is not made for those of us with larger breasts. Could not button up fully and the buttons I did manage to fasten popped open at the slightest movement. So sad I could not wear this super cute dress.
The fabric of this is very thick meaning the sleeves of this thing are seriously poofy. It was just too much for me. Medium was too large for me. I recommend sizing down.
So cute on - and it has POCKETS!!! Was surprised to find my normal size S was too big everywhere though, so size down.

links_reviews_title: Pretty blue dress on the hanger...
links_reviews_text: First off, this dress runs large. Maybe if it was my size I would have liked it better, but I dont think so. It's certainly a look, sort of like you are a doll playing dress up. It doesnt feel very grown-up, more child-like. A bit prairie. But the blue color is really pretty and just as vibrant in person. Got it with the tags on and returned it with the tags on. Check out all the pieces I DID wear @luxeandlouch :)

I was fortunate to get both pieces at once. This material is a bit heavy but I wore it without hose on a 66 degree day and was comfortable. I paired with a tie at the neck top and turned up the sleeves of the jacket to allow the blouse sleeves to show. The skirt and sleeves are long so if you're petite, this may not work. But tall gals are set!

Great jacket! As you can see in the photo the knit texture is fine-ribbed. The square and rectangular "dots" are a very light gray color. I had some trouble with the zipper but I just put it on over my head zipped and it was fine. Very stretchy with fabulous tailoring. Wish I could have paired it with the matching skirt.

links_reviews_title: The most amazing power suit you'll ever wear
links_reviews_text: Rent this with the matching skirt (or wear it with a plain black skirt or fitted pants--even jeans!) and you'll wish it wasn't so $$$ to buy. It's absolutely incredibly designed and well-detailed. The fit is perfect and the sleeves are long. I can't say enough great things about this jacket/suit.
I wore this to work over a black dress. It was pretty much exactly what I expected... stretchy, easy to wear, cute. Only complaint is that I wish the sleeves were a tad shorter and tighter
I normally wear a 12/14 and the 14 was tight. That being said, I loved this jacket on every level and will most likely rent it again.

links_reviews_title: I would wear this everyday if it were socially acceptable to do so
links_reviews_text: I waited for this suit to be available in my size for a while and it was well worth the wait. One of my favorite rentals thus far. I rented both pieces to wear together. It is so comfortable! I cannot stress that enough. And the photos online just cannot do the pattern justice. It is beautiful. The jacket has functioning pockets which are a plus (if someone has removed the seam, which was not done on mine so I did) and a double zipper so you can zip/unzip from top or bottom. Multiple people encouraged me that I had to buy it, but the price makes that prohibitive. Will likely rent again.
Wore this jacket out to dinner. It was high quality, beautiful cut and well made. Sleeves were very long as others mention but I was able to fold cuff without a problem.
Beautifully made blazer, sleeves were pretty long, and didn't fit well in the bust for going up a size.
Just wasn't the right top for me. Too tight and sleeves were too long. Don't think I would have worn if I sized up either. This is for the very slender and tall type.

links_reviews_title: Great fabric, very interesting jacket. Zipper is VERY tight, almost impossible to zip.
links_reviews_text: Fit is snug around waist. Sleeves are long and fitted. I am ordering again one size up. Love the fabric and style. Hope the next zipper is better.
TTS. Great for everyday light jacket.

links_reviews_title: Perfect comfortable and classy work attire
links_reviews_text: Material was thick and stretchy and very comfortable. Sleeves were about 3 inches too long for my arms, but it fit very well and I will definitely rent again. So comfortable and versatile!

links_reviews_title: Cute! Made my waist look tiny!
links_reviews_text: Cute fun and comfortable dress! It is really light material and I would recommend it for summer or w a jacket in spring/fall. Colors weren't as vibrant as I hoped for but a great easy dress.
Great fit! It did take a bit of time to iron it, but well worth it.
I was excited to wear this one but the material is definitely not for winter. It's cute but I did t wear it because of material but also it was a bit revealing for my figure.

links_reviews_title: The fit and color were perfect!
links_reviews_text: I love wrap dresses and this one was so flattering and easy to wear. I will rent this one again in the spring.

links_reviews_title: Super pretty, flattering on curves, nice length
links_reviews_text: I love this dress. It is a very pretty color and hugs curves but still looks appropriate. The knee-length made it great for work. As it is a wrap dress, I did opt to wear bike shorts underneath and I was glad that I did.
Cute cotton wrap dress. No stretch, so no give at all. Nice bright color, wore on a casual day to work
I have a very large chest and this dress surprisingly fit me very well! Got compliments.
Dress flies open - NYC streets are gusty - use a pin unless you want to show it off the whole walk paired it with a tank top for more discretion at the office.

I wanted to like this because the style is so unique but the material was very scratchy and just made me itch for the few hours I wore it. It's pretty snug too which is fine but I found it would twist around a lot so the side slit ended up showing off my belly a bit. I couldn't wear it more that an hour or so before I decided to change.
I received so many compliments all night.
Excellent length and fit. Fabric was a bit thin. Styled as shown!
Loved it - but wasn't the right look for the event - fitted, true to size. A little thin - so bra was needed.

I wore this for two photoshoot a, one with jeans and one without with a high boot and it's a show stopper!! I will end up buying this although I'm allergic to wool only bc the wool content is very low. It's worth the sacrifice for the look! Lol
Absolutely loved how this fit and the style. But itchy material so didn't keep to wear again.

I wanted to love this. The design and the fit were great but the fabric was so itchy and uncomfortable. I washed it again thinking it might help, but no luck. Not sure if it was just me but I couldn't wear this :(

5'7" and usually a size 10/12. Got a medium and large and the large was more comfortable, especially in the chest area. Could have gone XL if needed more space in arms. I loved the look and feel of it, paired with jeggings and black heels. Want to buy this now!

Loved this sweater. Fits very true to size although its form fitting. Wore it with leather Spanx leggings and loved it. Agreed with a previous review that its a little sheer but not bad. Would 100% rent again.
Loved the high slit on this. Wore this to a holiday party with black leggings and looked very sleek. Also wore to work with blue jeans. The material can get a bit itchy if you are sensitive to wool.

Nice long warm sweater. Runs true to size. Some stretch. A good layer for jeans and leggings. I liked it with black skinny jeans l, but could also be worn with blue. Super cute and easy to style, but different. Would absolutely rent again.

links_reviews_title: Received compliments the whole day I wore it
links_reviews_text: I wore it over a leopard midi skirt for a little pop of "color" and it looked so cute together. Great fit, good fabric--not too thick and not sheer. I ended up buying this piece
This piece is anticlimactic. For an unusual basic, it's fine. Fits fine. I ended up tying it around my waist because it got to be rainy. True to size.
It was cute. Wore to a concert. Fit well. Comfortable and true to size. Fun rental but wouldn't purchase.

most definitely looks best with heels as it's quite long, I paired with skinny jeans and it looked fantastic. fabric is a bit thin and not very soft, which was its only negative. I'll totally rent this again!

links_reviews_title: Perfect Bag for an Island Vacation
links_reviews_text: Loved this bag because it keeps your items out of site but is easy to look through. Super cute and light - it goes with everything on vacation. I loved this one particularly bc it's not something I would necessarily buy but loved having for this trip.

links_reviews_title: This was a little smaller than I pictured but a great fun tote!!
links_reviews_text: I loved caring it !
This is probably the best bag I've ever used because if it's shape and durability and also style. I wish I could afford to buy it because I've already kept it for 2 weeks

links_reviews_title: Great bag. Very versatile and good for all summer occasions
links_reviews_text: Cons are the inner bag is hard to navigate so I used the purse without it and it was fine.
A little scrunched up when I got it. Stuffed it and it bounced back. Pretty color and thin, but sturdy handles. Wish it was a little larger-- I like the look of a larger tote.
This bag was pretty small. Nice, but didn't meet my needs.

On the one hand, I love the woven look and the leopard liner is unique. But this bag was brand new, yet looked worn, and the liner top flops around awkwardly 90% of the time. It's not realistic to tie it off and untie the liner every time. Admittedly, I didn't wear the bag without the lining - maybe that would be been better. I wore it for 3 days and returned.
Love everything about this bag, perfect size- not to big, for everyday!
Great quality, very fitted - size up if you don't want it so figure hugging. Sparkle on neck and sleeves adds elevated touch.

Nice and versatile piece. Gold sparkly collar is itchy. Knit is thin- you need a camisole. I dressed this up with black slacks and heels for the office, but it could be worn with jeans for a more casual look.

links_reviews_title: OBSESSED...wish I could own this one!
links_reviews_text: I never thought I would wear an $1,100 shirt; now that I have I kinda get it... I received this shirt new with the tags still on, and fell in love with the colors/print as much in person as I did in the pictures. The material where the design/print is was thick and felt high-end, the off-white portion is fairly see-thru as you can see in my pics. Even though a ribbed top that is supposed to be fitted, it never lost its shape and went "baggy" (again proving why it is an expensive top). I know it is just a shirt, but I felt like a million bucks in it going to dinner while on vacation. Well worth a rental!

links_reviews_title: Fun color block and signature Missoni style
links_reviews_text: I was really excited to get such an expensive, designer piece NWT! Despite the more casual look shown on the RTR model, I decided to try to dress this up and wear it to work by tucking it into a simple black pencil skirt. Material is very comfortable, though the gold trim feels a little funny. Thin and slightly sheer, though acceptable with proper nude undergarments.

Absolutely love this sweater! It is very thin so I wore a white cami under. Paired it with blue jeans and gold ballet flats for a Friday work look. I didn't find the gold collar to be itchy at all, as mentioned in another review. Will definitely rent this one again!

Flattering sweater. Beautifully made. Thin but surprisingly very warm. I wore it to walk around outside on a wintry day and I wasn't cold. The gold stitching details around the cuff and collar were beautiful touches. My favorite rental so far.
Loved it! Fit true to size and so unique. I've been wanting to wear Missoni since I heard of the brand as a teen. Thanks for making my Missoni dreams come true RTR!

links_reviews_title: close fitting, neck a little high/tight
links_reviews_text: wanted to love but found it just ok -- hard to figure out what to pair with
Has sparkles around the collar with is a fun addition. Runs large so definitely size down.
Got it with tags on! Fits so well and very flattering. Beautiful, unmistakable Missoni pattern. It was hard to pick a bra that was appropriate given that the white part is quite sheer.
I liked this dress but did need to pin it in order for it to be work appropriate. I like the size belt and the length. Definitely a fun piece to try out.

links_reviews_title: Looks good, a bit hard to keep things in place
links_reviews_text: Needs to constantly adjust it when sitting down; but otherwise good

links_reviews_title: Kinda low-cut, so I paired with turtleneck. Liked the flow of the skirt part of the dress!

links_reviews_text: I spend all the reviews that warn about the slit, it will fly open. Also note that there is a deep V in the front that is very revealing. Good dress, not great
This dress is constructed weirdly but it was comfortable and flattering enough to wear to work.
Loved this dress. Wore a cami under it. True to size.

I like the look and feel of this dress, but unfortunately I cannot wear it. I'm a true size 6, and this dress fits me well everywhere except my chest. It gapes obscenely, it's like it's cut ONLY for A-B cups. Super disappointing but alas, the high fashion world is not for curvy women. I swear the day someone makes office wear for DD+, they'll be rich.

Love the clean, sharp lines. I take a 2 or 4 & decided to go with 2 in order not to be overwhelmed by the dress. Overall the best decision, but meant I had to pin the neckline because it would have been too low cut. This is the kind of dress that would look best on a B or A cup, but I love the style so much I made it work with a safety pin & some fashion tape.

Styled like a coat dress, featuring quality, weighty fabric. It is held closed by only 3 hidden buttons & a trench-like belt at the waist that makes for a deeply cut top & a moderately high slit in the skirt. I styled w/a cami & think a long sleeve tee or turtleneck would look great in winter also. I didn't have any problem w/the skirt being too revealing as there is an extra layer of fabric in the part of the skirt that crosses over that can be manipulated when sitting. Tights in winter would create additional modesty.

links_reviews_title: Couldn't wear because it was not work appropriate
links_reviews_text: The dress had definitely seen better days. It had an ugly sheen to it from being dry cleaned too much. The fit was super unflattering and despite me having a fairly small bust the dress gaped open and exposed my bra. You definitely need a shirt underneath it and that wasn't the look I wanted. The designer should have included a button near the bust. Too much work to try to salvage so sent it back unworn.

links_reviews_title: Needs a cami underneath but cute
links_reviews_text: Very low cut and basically open at the top - definitely needs a camisole underneath, especially if wearing to work.
I liked this dress, but I'm not cool enough to wear it. It's like Matrix meets witchcraft, but make it fashion.
Cute and different. I wish i had sizes down. I'm a 6/8 and the 8 was a tad big but at least the belt is adjustable

I love this dress. However, it is what we call a standing dress, not a sitting dress. The neckline gaps like crazy and the slit is uber revealing when you sit, but standing and walking it all works perfectly. I wore it to a gallery opening and got quite a few compliments. I am small on top and agree that the dress would not work on a larger bustline. As a whole the dress was a bit roomy on me, and if I order it again I will order my normal size instead of a size up.
Perfect fit, elegant

Loved this dress and got a lot of compliments on it. The belt is a little confusing but once I figured it out I did not have issued with my bra showing. Would rent again or even buy if it was a little less expensive.

links_reviews_title: Nice but you have to wear with something underneath
links_reviews_text: I'm glad I wore it with a layer underneath, it shows a lot of the body when you're sitting and moving.

Everyone talks about that slit, and for good reason. It's a bit weird and problematic when walking, for sure. I handled the top issue with a hidden safety pin and that worked well. However, the bottom part of the wrap dress has buttons to hold it together but they don't go very far down your leg. It also weirdly has a lot of heavy fabric (separate panel for the buttons underneath the top layer). As you're walking, the slit kicks open with every step and there's really nothing you can do about it except try to hold it shut as you walk. It's a cute enough dress that this isn't fatal but definitely don't plan to wear it at an important work function or presentation because you'll be limited in movement and slightly uncomfortable.
Neckline so low and gapping that I needed to wear a blouse under it, but that looked good. Fabric is sturdy enough that this was a good outfit for a cold day.
Great dress, just a little small. I usually wear a 10 and was sent an 8. I'm sure the 10 would be perfect.
It’s a very cool silhouette, but a little too low cut for me. I had to pin it to keep the cleavage under control.

I rented this for work with the expectation that I was going to wear a long sleeve under it. Nope - looked awkward. So, expect a low cut. It's long - almost too long for 5'4 body. I am a 0/2 and the 2R was best. 0 would have been too tight. I didn't end up wearing this - which bummed me out.

links_reviews_title: Wore this to a work conference and got so many compliments! It's so professional, elegant and chic!
links_reviews_text: I sized down and it for perfectly. Love the hidden belt

I've tried the red, plaid and glorious green versions of this dress. Personally this was my least favorite of the four but my colleagues loved it. I thought it was giving sack vibes but they thought it was giving pulled together sleek professional vibes. The green one is by far my favorite and the red is nice too I needed a modesty layer

links_reviews_title: AMAZING with a couple of warnings...
links_reviews_text: This dress is fabulous! I love the fabric and design. However, it REALLY needs a snap or hook in the chest area. Be prepared to pin the chest or fall out the entire time you are wearing it. Also, if it is a windy day, beware of the slit, as it is a little higher than usual.

I wore this for a work event and received many compliments. It's very forgiving. The 10 was too small and very revealing. The 12 was a little big but comfortable. I just needed a safety pin as the neckline is very revealing.
Cute dress but since I have curves it wasn't the most flattering dress on. I felt it made me look more hippy than I wanted for what I was wearing it for. Cute dress though
Fits true to size
I wish this had come in petite. It was basically to my ankles and as a result was way too low cut in the front.
This dress was perfect for work except that it was a little low in the front. I added a white sleeveless equipment blouse though and it looks cute layered. Will rent again for sure.
I love this style for work - made me feel great. It's very comfortable and stylish. I wore a safety pin to cover up my chest and it stayed secure all day. It would be too revealing without.

This is a fun black dress with an interesting cut and belt detail - HOWEVER. I had to go home from work because the slit and bust kept opening up - so uncomfortable. it's too bad there isn't a button at the top - awkward as there is SO much fabric, construction is weird.

Although my fiancé and sister said this dress looked like something a corporate vampire would wear, I loved it. The collar is more dramatic than I expected and the dress itself is longer than I anticipated, but it's still a great dress.

I rented this for the office - and really wanted to love it. The buttons for the wrap don't go far enough down the leg - so it creates a really high slit whenever you walk, get a gust of wind, or sit down.... And the bust is SUPER revealing.

links_reviews_title: Beautiful but gapes at the chest
links_reviews_text: This dress is thick and forgiving, very sleek and expensive looking, but all that is lost in the way it lays at the chest. The collar folds don't stay flat and the highest button is just above my natural waistline, meaning the material at the chest is just wide open. Still worth renting, just be prepared with a large safety pin. Not recommended if you're larger than a D cup or apple shaped.
Very flattering and slimming belted dress. A favorite!

links_reviews_title: Not the most flattering for curves
links_reviews_text: I didn't end up wearing because it added too much fabric
Loved this dress just too big and wanted a size smaller but made it work.
Loved this dress, had great flow and I got a ton of compliments.

links_reviews_title: Perfect print, love the cut/length. A lot of material but it works.
links_reviews_text: I liked this dress more that I thought I would. Animal print was a hit and the varying length and wrap-like style worked. I wore with a cardigan and only when I went to take it off did I notice my bra straps clearly revealed in the back, so be aware.

I am usually pretty self conscious of my midsection but the wrap effect of the dress helped me to feel comfortable and stylish! The slit in the front does not come up too high and made me feel chic. I usually wear a 38DD and the top was a little bit big but not noticeably so. Overall I was really pleased with this dress! Wore it at an engagement party and would definitely rent it again.
I tied it in the back - works either way.
This dress is fun to wear and very flattering. The outside layer ties at the waist, adding a way for you to flex the sizing.
I love this dress so much. The waist tie makes it super flattering and the fabric is flowy and light. I want to own it.

Dress is lightweight, but lined so no need for additional undergarments. There is a keyhole cutout on front chest, but not enough gap to cause issues (at least for this B cup gal). Easy in/out, so no issues w zippers or needed help to get dressed.
Very cute!
Beautiful dress -- a bit too large in the chest area, but not a problem to wear.

On the hanger, this looks beautiful. I put it on and quickly realized that the elastic waist makes the top balloon out above my waist and the skirt balloon out below it. When you add to that the faux-wrap feature, that’s just another layer on top of the ballooning. I tried tying it around the back like I read in the reviews, but the skirt beneath has an odd style to it— it’s cut like the conservative denim skirts my mother wore to church in the 90’s. So then I was blobby AND school-marmy. But with major cleavage. In general, I’d call this dress a risk and suggest getting a second, back-up style JUST IN CASE so you don’t end up tearing apart your closet in a panic like I did.

Beautiful flow. Great wrap skirt with a tie bow.a split in the front. Key hole a little long for my taste. Should have ordered the Large - I think that would have fit me better. Usually a 12/14 petite - the length was good for me. Nice chiffon material.
This dress was so comfortable!! It fit perfectly on my chest/shoulders and was very flowy on the bottom half. The tie at the waist was super flattering.
I rented this and thought it would be cute with a black blazer and heels for work. Huge slit in the cleavage area-totally NSFW. Also, runs big! Returned without wearing :(
The keyhole is low you have to wear something underneath or pin it together but other than that it was perfect under a black blazer for work and easy to walk around in

links_reviews_title: Unique Design Marred by Cheap Fabric
links_reviews_text: I was excited to incorporate a little animal print into my work wardrobe this fall, and this dress seemed like such a winner. However, once I received it, I was disappointed by the cheap fabric. It felt like material for Forever 21 rather than a mid-range designer piece. Also, the front neckline slit is a little too revealing to be work appropriate despite the button holding it closed. Overall, not a bad piece. Just not a piece worth anywhere near its retail price.
Overall great fit, easy pull on style. What I didn't realize from though was the peekaboo at the bust line. A little too much exposure to wear to the office, so I threw on a jacket over top.
it's just flowier than I expected but good to try new things
Cool pattern more flow like that I expected

links_reviews_title: very low neckline, needed to wear a tank--completely open which wouldn't really be work appropriate
links_reviews_text: Fun and flowy, love the belt detail. Fabric is light, feels summery and springy.
Comfortable and easy to style. Love the tie feature, but the top was quite large. I will size down if I rent again.
Armholes too deep, showed all of bra. Keyhole in front too revealing. Needed to pin a LOT to wear to work
Cute, Foley fabric. Wish I had gone with sm.

links_reviews_title: Very fun and comfortable weekend dress
links_reviews_text: So easy to wear, would fit all shapes, very flattering even for short people like me in flats. Wore it to the zoo then BBQ. Lasted all day. Amazing

links_reviews_title: nice dress, not a good fit for me
links_reviews_text: nice dress but not a good fit for shorter people with a little bit of a belly.
Fun and flattering. A little tent like but flattering

links_reviews_title: Cute dress and print, but keyhole opening is too low cut for the office.
links_reviews_text: Cute dress and print, but keyhole opening is too low cut for the office (and maybe for otherwise). It looked oddly slutty for something that is otherwise a fairly buttoned up cut.
The Large was slightly too big for me; I think I am in between a large and a medium.
Too blousy, too much fabric.

links_reviews_title: Large and made me look larger
links_reviews_text: This might work better if you size down, but the bottom has quite a bit of fabric, which made my look very large on the bottom. The top was fine, but a little loose.

Loved this!! The print is great--a fun cheetah done in a way that looks high-quality. The fit is true to size. I am usually a 16 and could probably have sized down, but found the XXL more comfortable. Will definitely be renting this one again!

links_reviews_title: It's really a party or date dress, not a work dress.
links_reviews_text: Fit great.
The fit is TTS, and the length is perfect for wearing with leggings. It can be worn standalone or open. It's VERY cozy and warm and not itchy at all.
Nothing too special about this sweater but it was comfortable and cute. The small was roomy without being baggy. Would recommend.
So soft. Runs a bit big and boxy.
Comfy, great material, soft. Can be worn so many ways. Just love it!

The other reviewers had warned that the fit was small. I was going for a more fitted look to pair with high waisted jeans or pants so the small size worked for me. As for the brand and price point, I expected a better quality (it was great for a rental but I wouldn't buy it.)

links_reviews_title: This turtleneck is even better than I expected. I chose it for the color but the fit is what I loved
links_reviews_text: It fit me so perfectly. The length is perfect. Not too long and not too cropped.

Shorter length, looked good with higher waisted jeans. Material isn't that forgiving so it you feel self conscious around the belly area this may not be the best choice. Nicely made. Wouldn't buy for $200 but. Great rental. Received compliments.
This definitely runs small and REQUIRES high waisted pants. The color is great though and it is super comfortable! It's very thin but very warm too! I loved this I wore it several times!
Very comfortable, fits like a glove and great colour. Everyone should own this!
This light wool sweater has cute piping on the hem and cuffs. It has a general sporty feel to it. Would make a great layer for a ski trip.
This sweater is beautiful and soft, but it runs small. For me it was too short in the torso to wear, but lovely for a more petite person.
I am normally a size 4, I got this in a medium and it was so short on me. I feel like everything recently has been a crop top. Get some normal length tops!

links_reviews_title: Wore this for an informal Xmas dinner party at a friend's house. The color was spot on!
links_reviews_text: As other reviewers have commented, the sweater is very short on the torso. You really need something high waisted to pull this off. One more thing - although the material is somewhat thin, I was very warm in this sweater. For those who "run hot" like me, this may not be the sweater for you.
Even the large might have been too small in the chest. It felt a little itchy too
Rented in December. The red was perfect color for season. Can layer if wearing in colder weather or alone. Dress up or down, it is ideal staple piece for wardrobe.
This is a tight fitting sweater, and fantastic fabric. However, it's super short! It barely hit the top of my high waisted pants, so it looked weird and I didn't wear it.

Loved this but wasn't as versatile as I hoped as It was very short and could only be worn with high waisted pants. I usually wear a small or xs but needed a medium in this one and It was still Very fitted.
Beautiful but tight (and slightly thin) sweater. I ordered a medium - usually wear a 4 - and I probably could have ordered a large!
I loved it

links_reviews_title: Wear M/L in sweaters, but the runs small for me in the bust. Beautiful, wish it came in XL Sent back
links_reviews_text: see above
Good quality, but run small.
this runs very tight and leaves nothing to the imagination.
Fit is tight but looked great under a sleeveless black dress.

links_reviews_title: Could not wear it -- way too tight and short
links_reviews_text: This sweater was ridiculously small. Too tight. Too short. Really felt like it has been accidentally shrunk, because a medium should not be so small that it would barely fit my 70 pound 10 year old.

I sized up to a large based on the reviews but wish I had not. At 5"7" and 145 I usually wear a medium, which I think it would have fit better. The large was about right in the torso length but slightly large in the arms and width. This is sheer but nothing a nude cami could not cure. The color is a dusty red. Overall, I would not rent this again.
Love this turtleneck - great soft fabric, lightweight, beautiful color. Would rent again! I sized up after reading the reviews and the large fit perfectly.

links_reviews_title: Nice pink/orange color with interesting detail on the neck. Neck is quite high.
links_reviews_text: Love this, but the small was too small for me. Will get it again in the medium.
Too tight of a fit to be practical but a nice sweater.
So tiny. It fit my 14 year old so she wore it, but I did not.
This sweater fit well and is soft. I liked it but did not think it was extra special. I wasn't a huge fan of the black in the turtle neck.
Wasn't clear it was two-toned from photo. Fabric not very stretchy for a sweater. It was sort of cute, but just not the usual Rag & Bone quality.
Fit was small and fabric thin. A nice option for under suit jacket in office but not really great as a separate to be worn alone. Nice collar showed great with necklace.

links_reviews_title: Not a good choice for long torsos
links_reviews_text: I am tall and have a long torso. The length of this sweater is awkardky short. It also seems to run small overall.
Loved the color and the material. It was a little too short. I needed to wear an undershirt underneath. Otherwise, when I raised my hands, my tummy showed.

links_reviews_title: Too short! This top is an awkward length that kept riding up all day. Would not rent again.
links_reviews_text: This top is an awkward length that kept riding up all day. Would not rent again

links_reviews_title: Runs small and tight around the neck
links_reviews_text: Great sweater but size up, tight around the neck
This is the sweater you run to social media to tell everyone about, but it's soft, polished, and looks great under a blazer.
Nice sweater, but it was a lot smaller and more cropped than I expected it to be so I didn't end up wearing it. Size up!

I read previous reviews and thankfully sized up two sizes. Perfect fit though sleeves are long. Note this is also extremely short - you will need to wear w high waisted bottom. The fabric is wonderfully soft and comfortable and the stitching at the neck makes the sweater. Received complements at work for the beautiful color.
