Adorable pattern and cut. However, the torso and upper arms felt tight and constricting. Originally rented for work but it was too short--and I'm only 5' tall. I wore it all day on the weekend because it's so cute but I was pretty uncomfortable!
Cute dress. Wasn't crazy about The sparkly silver in it. Would be great for the holidays. It was still very cute and would have worn but too tight for me in the bust area.

links_reviews_title: Really cute look but short and ran small.
links_reviews_text: I couldn't fit it over my bust!

This is a pretty plaid dress. This is the second time I ordered the dress because I ordered medium first and it was too small and too short (for the office). The large fit better but the fit wasn't perfect. The plaid is very pretty.

I wore this dress for our Christmas office party. I wanted to wear something comfortable, a bit modest, yet chic and stylish... and this dress was perfect! I got a ton of compliments when I wore this dress!

The tartan made this dress. The drop waste was flattering, but drew attention to the mid-section. The bottom pleating adds a bit of volume, so it wasn't the most flattering ever for my pear shape-but the fun fabric made up for that.

links_reviews_title: Cute dress that surprisingly fit well
links_reviews_text: As you can see...I wore this to medieval times :) Since it is a fitted bodice, I was not expecting this to fit so well and I was surprised it was not too short! The fabric has metallic but is pretty soft. This is great for a holiday party & looked super flirty with the fishnets!

links_reviews_title: Well made, so many compliments!!! Minimized my breasts whilst enhancing the length of my legs. Amen.
links_reviews_text: The textile is stunning in daylight into evening. Great transitional dress. I wore Gucci navy loafs in the day and Prada pumps in the eve. I did rock a navy stocking. Probably would have gone with a sheer semi sheen , maybe even a nude idk. Still it worked and it was fabulous.
Literally-no stretch. Recommend sizing up for sure! I'm athletic build and couldn't get this over my biceps, lol.
Very form fitting, especially the waistline.

This dress is really cute, and great for work! It's also very glittery, which is not really clear from the picture - not my usual vibe, but was happy to rock it at the office for one day. The material is high quality and comfortable. I'm on the shorter side, so it was longer on me than it is on the model in the picture. I'm usually around a size 2 and somewhere between an XS and S, so I ordered a size Small to be on the safe side since it looks super fitted in the picture. It was baggier on me than on the model in the picture (re: not tight at all in the torso, and had more of an "oversized" fit than a fit-and-flare look.) I probably should have ordered a size down, but overall, this was a cute office look!

I wore this on a date with my husband. I loved how the dress fit and made me feel. When I ordered this, I was worried the dress might be too short. Thankfully, it covered everything, and I felt confident wearing it.

Rented this with my unlimited for a nice fall dress. Really this is for a holiday party. There is silver threading run through it and it is not subdued enough for every day wear. Also runs very small and is very short. I am a 5'2" and a 0/2 and the XS was suffocating and many inches above my knee. Sent it right back without wearing.

1. This runs way small. I'm true to size 6, sometimes 4, and I didn't have a chance of zipping up the S. I usually don't shy away from showing some leg, but it was much shorter than I expected, granted too small all around. 2. The accent stitch is a very shiny silver. The dress immediately felt "holiday" upon sight. Not the fall look I was going for. Overall, it wasn't what I expected. May reconsider (in a bigger size!) in a couple months.

I think I agree that this sweatshirt runs small. I ordered a medium and it fit like a small. I relied of the rtr size estimate and it worked. I feel like if you want a tight fit, order your actual size, otherwise 1 size up should do ya. I'm a 4/6 top and the medium was perfect.

Let me preface this review by saying that I usually wear a M/L on top. I opted for an XL in this sweatshirt because I wanted it to be oversized and comfy. It looked so small as soon as I took it out of the package that I thought they sent me the wrong size. Nope, it was the XL. It just fit my mother who is a small.

Overall I really like this sweater. I didn’t get a chance to wear it because it’s a heavy, winter sweater and the weather in Seattle right now just doesn’t require this amount of warmth from a sweater. The color is fantastic, the pattern on the back is cool, the neckline is fun. I would rent this in the dead of winter and could wear with leggings, jeans or slacks.
The pattern is exactly what it looks like in pictures. The sweater is really soft and fit well. I wore a medium, and it was loose and cozy.
Didn't realize the back of the sweater had a fair isle design! Kind of fun. VERY heavy, good for a chilly office or a ski weekend.
I rented this to wear on a trip to Iceland. It was super warm, cozy and cute. Love the detail on the back!
Almost as thick and heavy as a ski sweater. Loved the surprise back design. Got lots of compliments.

Rented this to wear for a cold weekend day. I sized up for an oversized/comfy fit. I probably would have been fine with a small even to get an oversized feel. It was really thick and warm. Loved the fact that the back was a different pattern from the front.
Love the tonal purple pattern in the front and the fair isle in the back. I got a medium but should've gone with small for my size.

links_reviews_title: Cozy, comfy, refuse to take it off!
links_reviews_text: This sweater is unusually warm! I've worn it enough this month to know it's ridiculously warm and often forego my coat if I'm in this bad boy. It's a gem as it's comfy, cozy, (not itchy!) I love the crew neckline and it's subtle textured look. The pattern on the backside keeps it popping as a eye- piece. I am normally size S, but like my sweaters oversized. I should have gone with an M, but I'm not mad about the L that I got, shown in this pic

I loved this sweater in person as much as I thought I would from the pictures – the combo of dark (can’t tell if it’s dark purple, gray, or blue) under the lavender main color and the contrasting pattern on the front and back are just really cool. I do like the overall fit of the sweater, which was boxy but not oversized. It was short but I wouldn’t say cropped. It did, however, actually feel a little shrunken on me – the sleeves were a good four inches short of my wrists and while it fit correctly and not too small in the shoulders, it was a little constricting (perhaps because of the thickness of the knit). The yarn was very soft but I wouldn’t say it exactly felt like cashmere-soft – definitely not itchy to me though. I love the sweater and would love to rent it again and might try a size up for a more comfy feel.
This sweater is flattering and cute for everyday wear. I paired it with skinny black pants and black loafers. Perfect casual office outfit on a cold day!! Love it.
I liked the color but it was a little boxy/baggy

RTR had this listed for "year-round" weather, but this is definitely a winter weather. However, it was so soft and beautiful that I couldn't help but wear it in 80-degree LA "fall." It ran a little large and felt a tiny bit puffy, though it was oddly tight at the neck. I didn't realize this, but the back has an awesome pattern which adds a nice touch.

I rented this for a weekend away in Maine but it was too small. I'm usually an 8/medium but it was too small all over (body, shoulders, and arms). I expected it to be oversized but would recommend sizing up. The detail on the back was really cute!
I ordered a few sweaters for the holidays and after looking at reviews I assumed it ran large. The xs looked like it was made for a kid or it shrank either way I couldn't get it on.

links_reviews_title: I loved this so much and wanted to buy it but was still a little expensive
links_reviews_text: oversized but cute, thick and warm. only downside I had a black shirt underneath and white fuzz was leftover after taking sweater off
It looks good. Not that comfortable. Interesting. Slightly itchy, I don't love the feel of the material, but nor does it feel like it is actually wool/natural. But I'm gonna have fun wearing it!

Super warm sweater, great for Chicago winters. Loved the lavender color. The sleeves were too wide, almost like a balloon sleeve but not quite. It was unflattering. Fine to wear once but won't be renting again.
Love the color and the detail on the back of the sweater. It's pretty thick material and a bit smaller then how it appears on the model so I would size up if I rent again.
LOVED this-- high quality, so nice!
The comfiest, softest sweater. Hated to return. Very warm.
This is a super warm sweater. The design on the back is neat and it's very soft, but nothing super special.
Love Love Love!!!

links_reviews_title: It didn't feel bulky but was very cute.
links_reviews_text: Super comfortable, warm, and cute. It was perfect for the holidays and family gatherings.
I liked the length of this comfy roomy sweater
n/a
Fit well, kind of boxy which I was looking for.

I wore with black skinny jeans and black suede ankle boots. I received many compliments for this sweater. The color was very pretty. The material was soft and extremely warm. I work in a cold clinic and I did not have to wear a jacket like I normally would. My only complaint was the peeling of the sweater material. There were little balls all over it like it had been over worn or over washed. I attempted to pick them all off before work, but this was impossible.
I loved this sweater. It has a boxy fit and is a thick material that is very soft. I wore my usual size S and it fit like it does in the model's picture.

links_reviews_title: Love unique detail on the back
links_reviews_text: Comfortable, high quality, loose but not baggy
Very thick and warm. Only for very cold weather!
Big, soft, cozy and very warm. Paired with black jeans for a night at the theater in SF.
a little big for my particular frame - sleeves a little long and had to fold them over once. but super comfy and wore 27 weeks pregnant so roomy enough for a bump

I can not express how soft this sweater is. Soooo soft. True to size. Hit right at my hips and right at the bottom of my palm. The neck did not feel tight or uncomfortable as some crewneck sweaters can sometimes get on me. I think I could have sized down but I love the oversized look with this pattern and style. Perfect for fall. Seriously - sooo soft.

This dress is very comfortable and classy. The picture I added is taken after a full day of work so a few wrinkles developed. The material is stretchy and has give. It is a form fitting dress so control top tights were needed to smooth out problem areas. I loved the puff sleeves and pattern, they combined to make this more than a boring basic. I will rent again.

links_reviews_title: Fits like a glove. Very flattering!
links_reviews_text: Rented for work and an evening work function. Got a ton of compliments. Looks very expensive and fits great. Material is not too thick but not thin either. Will rent again!
I wore this to a conference and it was perfect!
Comfortable and nice for work. Good fabric, nicely lined, fun sleeves.
Really liked this dress. Fit was TTS. Comfortable and flattering, received a lot of compliments. Would rent again.

Fit runs big (I'm between 2-4 and the 2 had room). Nice, thick fabric makes this great for cooler climates. Sleeves have volume, giving a normal dress more edge. I'm bookmarking for when I need a good work dress.

links_reviews_title: its cute but not for me
links_reviews_text: the arms are a bit bulky, the dress is cute but not for my body size, which is petite

links_reviews_title: A little tight and a little high neckline, pass

links_reviews_text: Great simple dress for work. If I ordered again I would go one size down because it seemed to run a little bit bigger than other Ralph Lauren dresses.

links_reviews_title: I LOVED this dress. The material is nice and thick which makes it "forgiving" in the stomach area.
links_reviews_text: Tailored in just the right places and fit well!

links_reviews_title: It was true to size, and easy to wear.
links_reviews_text: Professional look for work, easy to wear.

links_reviews_title: Solid professional looking dress for work.
links_reviews_text: I have broader shoulders so I didn't love the puffed sleeves for me because I felt like it made them look too broad. That being said, I did receive a lot of compliments when I wore the dress. It's a great work dress. Wore well all day. Not too clingy or tight in the tummy area.

links_reviews_title: Cute office-ready print and unique sleeves
links_reviews_text: I always go for a 0 in this brand because I find it tends to run a bit large, and this fit as expected. The slightly puffed sleeves are cute and I liked the windowpane print. I did find that I needed a little belt to break up the pattern a bit, otherwise it looked somewhat overwhelming on my small frame. Overall, this was flattering with that accessory, and it was comfortable and worked well for the office. It wasn't my favorite rental ever, but it did look cute. Would recommend.

links_reviews_title: Great classic Ralph Lauren work dress!
links_reviews_text: Material is great - fits and is very flattering. My favorite dress so far from RTR! wore it with a long Calvin Klein black and grey blazer and it worked!

links_reviews_title: Great dress for a work presentation!
links_reviews_text: I usually wear a size 6. Based on the reviews of this dress, I ordered a size 4 and size 2. Ended up wearing the size 2, and it didn't feel tight. It was comfortable. Definitely order 1-2 sizes smaller than usual.

links_reviews_title: I wanted to like this dress
links_reviews_text: Dress fit too awkwardly. Too right across the top and then baggy the rest of the way down.
The dress still had the tag on the dress but it was a little large
Cute dress - it ran big but I wore a blazer over it and it worked.
It was very flattering. I would rent again for a more formal workday or meeting

links_reviews_title: Perfect dress for a work meeting with clients.
links_reviews_text: This was a little tight in the chest, but perfect everywhere else. I am typically a size 4.

This is a great work dress, and it was also comfortable. I wore it on a whirlwind work trip from DC to Michigan, which was a total of 7 hours on an airplane and 4 hours of meetings. The dress still looked great at the end of the day!
Loved this dress after adding accessories - just the right amount of stretch and interesting threads throughout. True to size and perfect for work!
This is a cute dress but I found it ran large in the shoulders and was too long on me.

links_reviews_title: Evening grand opening event for work
links_reviews_text: I needed an outfit that was after 5, professional and comfortable. This was perfect. I wish I had chosen my actual size because it was runs big. But it was perfect look. I would rent this again.
Loved the high waist and vintage fit. I'm pretty short and length was perfect.

I own a few pairs of Levi's which I know I typically need to size up in so I did the same for this pair. I couldn't even button these! It's a shame because they are very cute - size up 2 sizes if you have any hips!

links_reviews_title: Who came up with this sizing!
links_reviews_text: I've never worn Levi's before but I figured 31R was a safe bet. I could barely get these jeans over my tights. I literally laughed as they got stuck around my hips and clearly didn't fit. I like the look of the jeans and I'm going to try them again in a larger size.
These jeans became baggy quickly. Not worth it to rent them
The fit was a bit frumpy on me, also didn't love the button fly.
This may be a Levi's thing but I am nearly always a 26 and I could have probably sized up to a 28. Be cautious when renting!
A little too fluffy at the peplum than I prefer but I got compliments on the color.

links_reviews_title: Nice thick fabric, perfect for a night on the town!
links_reviews_text: The material is thick and was great for winter so you could dress it up with a cute jacket outside but feel good inside places that crank up the heat in the winter.
Runs extremely small. Luckily it's a stretchy, scuba material, so I squeezed it, but definitely not my most flattering rental. Pretty color that's great for the holidays.
This top is fitted and the material is thick. I does stretch a little. I paired it with a pencil skirt and got lots of compliments. The peplum is a statement. It is not subtle at all.
Great color - wore to work and felt a little too fancy. The peplum flared a bit higher than I'd hoped but over all loved it

Loved the color, and the fit was good, just a little tight in the sleeves. The neck was not tight at all. The bottom flares out a lot, more than it looks like in photos. I wore it with ponte pants, but I think it would look great with a pencil skirt.
Gorgeous burgundy color. I wore this to work but it would also be great for a night out because of the form fit and structure. Based on other reviews, I sized up and it was perfect.
I wore this to work and then out to date night and this shirt was perfect for both! The fit was great and I got a lot of compliments on it!

The fit is true to size. I wore this to work in healthcare. As normally, for full chested women peplum can make your boobs look a hit larger. Just comes with the style. The material is pretty thick but wearable in warm weather. I'll probably get this again for the winter time to wear with a skirt and some booties. The peplum flares just above my naval. Overall love the fit!!
Fit nicely and was breathable, but was much thicker than I expected so it stuck out further than I expected in the mid section.

links_reviews_title: Love this top! I will order this one again. Super flattering!
links_reviews_text: I have a curvy body and this showed off my waist, which is important when you have a bigger chest. Couldn't stop getting compliments.
Rented this top for work. Loved the fit. Some reviews say that the peplum hits at an odd height. I can see that, I have a short torso and it hit me at exactly the right height.
Bought this for work. It was a comfortable thick stretch material. Would look great with jeans or black pencil skirt.
I think you can size down because the material has a nice stretch. Looks and feels like the price tag that comes with it.

links_reviews_title: I received a ton of compliments. It's different from my typical work outfit.
links_reviews_text: It's thick, but otherwise fit well, true to size.

As a taller girl, the shirt did not hit my waist correctly and was not remotely long enough. It was nice material and a pretty color; however, I wouldn't recommend for girls over the height of 5"6. The peplum line came right underneath my boobs.

links_reviews_title: Very cute, not sure it was my style
links_reviews_text: It was very form fitting, especially in the arms, which made it a little uncomfortable to me as I usually prefer a looser fit. I have some loose skin on my arms as well and I didn't love how it made that look. Overall I liked it but didn't wear it out because I didn't think the bottom part was all that flattering on me. Maybe if it had stuck out a little less.
Rented this for a conference. Material is sturdy but stretchy. Felt it ran a bit small, but I have larger breasts and arms. Could easily size up and still have fitted look. Would rent again.

links_reviews_title: Perfect statement piece to spice up your work wardrobe.
links_reviews_text: I ADORED this. This will be in permanent rotation. The fabric is nice and thick and the peplum is so cute and jaunty. It's very stretchy so maybe order a size down if you know you've had problems in that area before. There's nothing bad to say about this adorable top.

links_reviews_title: Beautiful too, peplum too high and exaggerated
links_reviews_text: I needed help zipping this one in each time, and a bra wasn't an option, there was no room! Looked great without however. I wish the peplum were more subtle and started lower where my natural waist is. Did the trick for concealing my yet-announced pregnancy though. Well made.

links_reviews_title: Not for tall girls with bellies!
links_reviews_text: I am a tall woman, not long in the body particularly, but too long for this top. If it doesn't come down to your waste before it flares out it ends up making you look HUMONGOUS from the side angle. I liked the color and the quality of this garment, but it was tight in the chest and too short to be flattering, I would've spent the night pulling it down.
Love the style but was too bulky-lookong for my full hips.
beautiful color, thick material, runs very small. I ordered 1 size up but should have gone 2 up. My shape is hourglass. I am a solid 10 or M in tops normally.

links_reviews_title: Great top, I'm between a 4 and 6. I ordered the 6 based off reviews and the fabric. It was perfect.
links_reviews_text: Beautiful top, but the peplum is a lot of fabric and may hide or add extra pounds to your midsection depending on your body type. The only issue I had was the invisible zipper. If you're not flexible you may need an extra hand to zip you in. That or expect to spend an extra 3-4 mins just zipping it up.

links_reviews_title: THIS WAS A BEAUTIFUL TOP! I paired it with Opening Ceremony side zip pants.....PERFECTION!
links_reviews_text: Very fitted at the bust and waist.
This is an amazing shirt. I love the fabric, it's form fitting but also stretchy. I felt very confident in it and the ruffles hide any unflattering stomach bulges. I would rent this over and over.
Beautiful, form fitting top. Runs a little small!

links_reviews_title: Didn't work on my long torso
links_reviews_text: Great fabric and blouse. Unfortunately didn't work on my long torso. Didn't wear. A great blouse for different body type.
Got this for work. Loved the color and i love a simple peplum. However this peplum was a bit intense for work. Would be super cute for going our or a dinner but not what i was looking for

links_reviews_title: Nice top. Not the most flattering on me.
links_reviews_text: I had never tried this style, and it didn't suit my body type. I am petite to athletic with smaller bust and waist and bigger hips. This just didn't hit the right places. The material is very nice so if the style suits you, this would be a very nice top. I still wore it a couple times to work. I generally wear a 2 and even the 4 was very tight, so I recommend sizing up.
Loved the fit.

Loved the look and style of this top! However the material is very thick and very tight. Definitely would have been a little more comfortable if I had sized up one more size. I was ok when I was standing or walking around but fairly uncomfortable when I sat in this top.

I'm not going to mince words: I have a very large chest. As a bustier woman, I usually feel quite uncomfortable wearing fitted tops and often wind up in clothes that make me look a lot larger around the middle than I am... Until now! This top fits perfectly, and hugs my waist in just the right spot, so my waist looks tiny but I don't feel like my chest is busting out or looking inappropriate. I love the deep, rich color, and the fabric is stretchy enough to move in, but thick, so it feels high quality. Also, the peplum itself is in a great spot, so I could eat all day without feeling self conscious, which I usually do in tighter clothes.
Ran a little small and the neck went up so high it gave me a rash.
I loved this dress and got lots of compliments. It's super flattering! I loved the thick material!
The zipper was really hard to manage

links_reviews_title: not a complimentary shape for me
links_reviews_text: didn't look good on me.
a little snug but beautifully made and rich color

links_reviews_title: Perfect fit for my bust line. Feminine, classic business causal

links_reviews_text: the material is very thick. Very tight fit.
Pants were nice, good material, but a little too puffy around the waistband for me. Wore once to dinner with family but didn't end up wearing them to work as I anticipated.
Comfortable. Can dress down or up. Love the fit

I liked these pants - the fabric was a little heavier than I expected, but had a really cute subtle flower pattern. This had buttons instead of a zipper at the waist - but it was very stretchy and elastic, so it wasn't too tight or uncomfortable. I liked the ruffle at the waist because it seemed to elevate what would have been a pretty basic pant otherwise. I didn't love these - but would wear again!

links_reviews_title: Great pants to kick up the everyday
links_reviews_text: Comfy and I'd say 2 is a "medium". Not the MOST flattering with my belly but comfort was great and such a cute pattern and cut for this short time of year with inbetween weather.
I was super nervous about these pants. They definitely pushed me outside my comfort zone but they were so amazing. I loved the look, they were Uber comfy and I got a zillion compliments.
The fabric is sort of rough and not comfortable. A button was missing. These are navy blue and light blue.
Nice work pants. It's breathable for those super hot days you wish you could wear shorts to work.

I rented these and wore them three times over the week I had them. They are light enough to be comfortable in the summer and the weight and the pattern set them apart. Very flattering. I'm usually a size 6 in pants and 4-6 in dresses and the 1 fit well.
These pants are super comfortable and definitely a cute, casual look.

Loving these trousers. A mix of casual and dressy, depending on the top. They are a looser fit around my leg and it makes them so comfy. Length is a perfect ankle pant. I am 5'8", 155 and am wearing the size 2 of this style. Normally wear an 8 in pants.

links_reviews_title: Did not rent for an event but rather for everyday wear.
links_reviews_text: Love these pants. Have styled them casually with a t-shirt and flats or sneakers for weekend wear, and also for work with a button down and chunky heels. They are incredibly comfortable and hold their shape after several wears. The pattern reads as very neutral in person.

One of my favorite rentals ever! Absolutely comfortable and flattering. Endless compliments. They are stretchy- I am a JCrew 6-8 and I wore the size 2. The detail is so cute and makes it easy to pair with fun options. I would have bought these if they were just a little less.
I thought these would have been more comfortable, the twill fabric was rather stiff. Wouldn't rent again as they weren't anything too special.
Super cute and what I was looking for but the waist was just a tad too tight.
Loved these earrings! Definitely a statement and not heavy at all!
I seriously went straight to their website to grab a pair for myself! Stunning!
Gorgeous earrings that pop!
These earrings garnered a lot of positive comments

links_reviews_title: Not sure I'll ever give these back!
links_reviews_text: I adore these earrings. They aren't the least bit heavy and add just the right amount of flair.
Got so many compliments on these earrings! Wished they were really mine! It's not too big or heavy at all! Perfect statement earrings...
Lightweight
Rented these for the holidays! Couldn't stop reaching for them to wear with my outfit.
So light! Catches the light, so Grecian goddess.

I own the smaller version or these earrings in black and gold. I wanted the larger all gold to go with a red dress for a black tie event. They are SO lightweight, and I got so many compliments on them! These earrings are everything!
Loved these for my black tie event. They were a stunning accent piece and not heavy at all.

Have been on the verge of purchasing these earrings so many times, so I was THRILLED when I saw them on RTR!!! Just as wonderful as expected! SUPER lightweight and comfortable for long wear. Thank you RTR!
These earrings were absolutely perfect-so light and comfortable, easy enough to wear all night dancing like crazy at a Madonna concert. Will definitely rent again.
Light, comfortable and a showstopper. Tons of compliments from strangers, perfect for a rock concert.
Usually I can handle big and flashy in daytime but these were too much for that. I really only wanted to wear them in the evening. Very light weight. Would rent again.

links_reviews_title: These were fun popping out from under my hair!
links_reviews_text: While I can't believe these retail for as much as they do (they are literally plastic), they were the exact look I was going for and punched up my all black outfit perfectly for a party I was going to. They're a little large in size, so if you're more petite or have shorter hair, they may be a little overwhelming. Overall did the trick for what I rented them for!

links_reviews_title: I loved these earrings. They made my whole outfit!
links_reviews_text: These are not too heavy and are very cute!

links_reviews_title: This is what you call a statement!
links_reviews_text: Opted for a simple dress for a winter wedding and went with these beauties as the only jewelry to compliment the dress. Super lightweight and received lots of compliments.

links_reviews_title: I love these more than anything i really might buy them
links_reviews_text: amazing
Everyone loved them. They are certainly large, but are not heavy at all and I barely noticed them once they were on.
These are perfect! perfect, so dazzeling, so many compliments! just bold and fun! you wont regret, i'm gonna rent again!
These are giant. I have short curly hair so they looked rather odd. They would look amazing on someone with longer hair. A definite statement earring!

links_reviews_title: Loved them so much I bought them!
links_reviews_text: These were my entry point into Rag and Bone. Loved them.

links_reviews_title: Best fitting white jeans ever. Ever!!!
links_reviews_text: White jeans can be very very tough, especially with my large thighs. And I absolutely LOVE these. They have plenty of stretch but because they're high waisted they don't stretch out and slip off at the end of the day. Not sure how they managed to make them comfortable yet able to hold you in tight at the same time. Pretty sure I'm buying them.
These are perfect! They aren't see through and the pockets don't look crazy like most white jeans

links_reviews_title: Great fit but a little long if you don't have long legs.
links_reviews_text: Fit great around my waist but the length was a little awkward because my legs aren't very long (I'm 5'4). However, I wore them twice: once with heels and once with flip flops and felt comfortable enough!
LOVED these! Fun flare and raw hem. They have a little stretch. Perfect for the summer.

I really struggle with buying and renting bottoms because I have athletic thighs and a smaller waist, and only a small percentage of bottoms end up fitting me correctly. These jeans fit me absolutely perfectly! It was such a relief to have a GREAT pair of white denim for my trip to Mexico! They are high waisted and very comfortable. I am considering buying them, but will absolutely rent them again in the future!
Not see-through and nice length.
a little bigger than most 26s fit me, could honestly probably wear a 25 but I like the looser fit for white jeans. I am 135 lbs and 5'2 and honestly so obsessed with them I will probably buy!
The waist runs a little small but cute pant.
Pants are nice, like the material. For someone under 5'7" you won't get the same ankle length look as the model does. These run long.

links_reviews_title: usually wear a 27 or 28....should of gotten the 28s...the 27s were just a tad snug
links_reviews_text: Too tight
no complaints
Very Cute
Fit like a glove--nice for a casual dinner or all Day. Very comfortable and looked great
Way to small. Couldn't even wear.
A little long so I had to wear heels which actually made them look cuter.
Some white pants/ jeans are too see-through and show every imperfection... these are thick enough nit to show the less toned parts. Love.
Very cute but a little see-through as are all white jeans
So flattering and comfortable!!! I am a 25/26 and these fit perfect in a 25

These jeans had stretch and were comfy but they gave me a front butt that was incredibly unflattering. This is my first stab at white jeans - maybe just not cut out for them. Who knows? They are okay - not great.

I wear a 28 at Madewell but sized up and I'm glad I did! These fit perfectly, even with my athletic thighs. I wish they were a little shorter (they just graze my shoes and I'm 5'6") but I'm impressed these aren't see through.

I liked these a lot but they got a lot baggier as the day went on and kept having to pull them up. I wasn't able to size down but I'm also short and they were pretty long on me. I ended up cuffing them and they were still cute but overall they were not the cropped jeans I imagined.
I was expecting these to hit just above my ankles, they felt more like jeans from the late-nineties
I need a size or 2 up.

links_reviews_title: Good quality, stretch denim with on-trend frayed, flared hem
links_reviews_text: Despite the stretch, the waist was too small. Overall sizing runs 2 sizes smaller than J Crew or Madewell denim, for reference.
I didn't care for the fringe at the bottom it was a lot longer than I expected but they fit so beautifully.

links_reviews_title: No event - just rented via Unlimited.
links_reviews_text: These jeans are incredibly small and the largest size would maybe fit a size 12-14. The jeans do have stretch, look super cute (on the hanger) but certainly do not accommodate a plus size.
Had the boyfriend fit I was going for but not too long.

links_reviews_title: Pretty stretchy so if you are between sizes, choose the smaller one!
links_reviews_text: Pretty good fit and good length for taller girls. I'm 5' 9"

Love these jeans! I am 5'2, so the jeans fell past my ankles- but looked great with a cute pair of sneakers and flat sandals. They were super stretchy, high waisted and overall very comfortable. Will rent again!

links_reviews_title: Too high waisted for my tummy.
links_reviews_text: Great jeans that arrived new with tags, but returning them.

links_reviews_title: Great jeans-came with the tags on!
links_reviews_text: Great fit overall but just not for me.

links_reviews_title: Perfect shirt. Can wear w anything. Dress up or down
links_reviews_text: Does wrinkle easily. Could have easily gotten a sz small. Lots of compliments.
Lightweight, fits true to size, comfortable. Keep in mind kind of low cut.
This top fit true to size. It was super light weight and comfortable. I wore this top a lot but mostly with jeans. I will definitely rent this top again.
Has a great fit, great for work or everyday. Lightweight material makes it's great top for summer

links_reviews_title: Light As A Feather and Perfect For Summer Weather!!
links_reviews_text: I rented this just as the NYC weather started to warm up. The fabric is super lightweight and breezy and perfect for a summer day. The cut is perfect for large-chests and the beautiful blue stitching and bell-sleeves add a fun flare to the top. I will wear/rent again!
I wore this out, to work and to church! I love this shirt

links_reviews_title: Fun boho top for everyday wear!
links_reviews_text: Rented to have a cute easy breezy top for WFH Covid stuff. It was great! Arms were a little tight where the stitching detail was but overall, fit flowy and cool.

links_reviews_title: Boho chic to dress up or down
links_reviews_text: Great details, runs a little short
This is a nice soft shirt. The embroidery around the arms is a little tight, so you may want to size up depending on your bicep strength. Other than that, an easy spring shirt.
I wore this to work and out to dinner. It's adorable and so flattering!
Love how it keeps you cool during humid and sunny days! My new favorite shirt!
found it elsewhere online and bought it for way cheaper though!
The blouse was pretty but ran very small across the chest and upper arms. I can usually wear an XL but not in this brand.

links_reviews_title: Great for that hacky sack game I missed in 1995
links_reviews_text: Fits fine, but very low cut. I rented this for casual, weekend wear. The style really looks like something someone would wear to play hacky sack in the 90s. Very dated, and not in a cute vintage way. It was fine to wear to the dentist, but that was it.
Perfect shirt for going from a chilly office to the hot weather outside
middle section of the arms/elastic felt a little restricting. noticed small hole forming in the back.
no
Love the casual fit

links_reviews_title: I didn't end up wearing this
links_reviews_text: Beautiful top with on trend sleeves. The medium fit across the bust, but ran small in the hips for my hourglass figure. I think this would look best on someone with darker hair. I am blonde, and the colors of the blouse washed me out.

links_reviews_title: I love the stitching and quality.
links_reviews_text: The whole fit is great if not a bit large, but not enough to classify it that way.
Cute and comfortable. Loved the hippy boho look.
Found that it was super casual, and would slump of the shoulders, so if you don't mind that, it is fine.

links_reviews_title: It was just for every day wear.
links_reviews_text: The fit was really nice. It was also very flattering.

links_reviews_title: It's a beautiful breezy top with surprising detailing and a super soft texture.
links_reviews_text: The embroidery around the elbows was a bit snug, but overall the shirt was beautiful and I wish I owned it!

links_reviews_title: Little tight in arms otherwise good
links_reviews_text: Arms tight, other fit is ok
While this is an airy top it had a more linen feel, making it somewhat less ideal for a warm summer day. It ran large and sleeves are voluminous.
I loved this top! Soft comfy fabric and pretty style and details. It looked like it ran large so I ordered it in a small ( I usually wear Medium). The small was perfect. It felt like mine.
The shirt runs a little large, normally I'm a Small. Great casual shirt for work or even for a vacation. Lightweight but not see through. Great quality and cute detailing.

links_reviews_title: I got a lot of compliments but didn't really feel cute in it
links_reviews_text: Despite all the compliments I got, I don't think it was very flattering. Also the fabric wrinkled so easily, not ideal for a desk job, and didn't make it look any better. Fit was great and TTS.

links_reviews_title: Nice jumpsuit - a little low cut
links_reviews_text: Rented this for work but it was a little low cut. I found myself adjusting and pulling it up every time I left my desk. The fit was good and would rent again, but not for work.

links_reviews_title: Unique, but not too much so as to be self-conscious. I got a lot of compliments on this jumpsuit.
links_reviews_text: Really nice color. A little different but still understated.
Beautiful jumpsuit.

links_reviews_title: A jumpsuit that works for the bootylicious
links_reviews_text: Fits great. I'm decidedly on the bootylicious side, which makes finding a jumpsuit really difficult. This one works!! The color is somewhere between navy and forest, almost black. I wish the belt was detachable so I could pair it with a different belt, but I will definitely order this one again.

links_reviews_title: I looked like a utility worker
links_reviews_text: Fit true to size...I guess, but there was nothing polished or elegant about this, so it looked like a (bad fitting) uniform on me.

I love everything this brand puts out! The fit was perfect & i received compliments all day long on the color/print. It was perfect for the office on one of the last days of summer. More stuff I loved on @thanksitsrtr or thanksitsrtr.com

I'm an inspirational blogger and recently did a photo shoot for my blog. I rented this dress because it's exactly in line with my brand colors. It is so beautiful in person! I loved how feminine and comfortable it was. It was a tad short but otherwise perfect.
Wore to dinner one night on vacation. Loved the color! TTS

links_reviews_title: Girls' birthday weekend in the Hamptons
links_reviews_text: The dress was cute and comfortable. The waist is quite fitted but stretchy; skirt is short but so am I so it was flattering. I loved it and would definitely wear it again.

Wore this dress on vacation after having rented the maxi before in the same color. Such a gorgeous fabric and easy to pack (doesn't wrinkle!) It runs true to size, I usually wear a 2 or 4 but only the Xs was available. Made it work, but would have been more comfortable in my own size :)
This dress is colorful, flowy, and fun! I wore it for work, then dinner and shopping with friends. True to size and comfortable.

SUCH a beautiful dress! Really fun and floaty. I wore it to a wedding rehearsal dinner. Not quite formal enough for my professional work setting but I wore it anyway because I just couldn't send it back without wearing it again. The middle area has flexibility to it despite the fact that it looks tight, it's comfortable and has nice give to it. I had to use fashion tape to keep the middle part together at the top, since I didn't want my chest showing. Overall a really lovely dress.

links_reviews_title: I wore this twice I loved it so much!
links_reviews_text: Wore this for a night out in Vegas and then a Night put in Cannes. I loved everything about this dress.

links_reviews_title: This dress! It may be my first KEEPER!
links_reviews_text: I loved almost everything about this dress. I wanted to order the 2 but it wasn't available. The 1 felt a little tight going on, but once I wiggled into it I was great. Plus, no back zipper was a bonus as my hubs wasn't around to zip me up. I'm short and short wasted, and that worked out ok for this one. The length of the torso and skirt were great. The color and fabric is beautiful. I couldn't see any wear or tear. And the icing on the cake? No crazy underwear needed! ;)

Loved the pretty fabric. But... Too short on me to wear without leggings...and thank goodness I did as the the skirt blew up numerous times. And the partially sewn-in slip wasn't the greatest design...a separate slip would have been easier. I want to try this same fabric in the maxi version.

links_reviews_title: This dress is so easy and fun to wear. Also travels well since it doesn't wrinkle.
links_reviews_text: The gold sparkles and the top material breathes nicely. You can wear with sandals or heels. Takes a moment to get into the slip so be patient. Great design and easy to wear.

I love everything about this dress! The fabric is light and brightly-colored, the waist is adjustable and stretches, and it can be dressed up or down. I did have to use double-sided tape on the top buttons in order for it to be work-appropriate, but it was worth it!

links_reviews_title: Beautiful dress!!!! Even more amazing in person.
links_reviews_text: One of my favorite dresses I've ever rented! Light for summer but with sleeves for the arm conscious. Loved the pleating and the length is perfect. The color is more beautiful in person and has a shimmery pattern that is very subtle. It's fully lined and comfortable with elastic at the waist. I wore it to a dance recital, to work, to a birthday dinner, out to drinks... it transitions through all of these perfectly. Got so many compliments! Im sure I'll rent again.

Beautiful color, flattering and comfortable fit - can be worn for many different occasions from everyday to work to vacation. I wore on all three! The intricate details are unique and Indian inspired, the color is eye catching, and the comfortable fit made me feel confident and comfortable able each time I wore it!

I wore this dress going out to dinner. Got tons of complements. I wore a size 2 but I am definitely not a size 2 (6-8, 34DD). Couldn't wear a bra because of the front being open which was a whole different experience. Otherwise a super cute dress!!!

I love this little comfy and boho casual dress ba&sh! Running true to size with stretch in the waistband, I recommend wearing your true size, and going up a size for your free back up. This style is roomy throughout the top midsection and flowy at the hips. It works best for all cup sizes. You are, are not able to wear a standard bra with this dress. At 5'3, the length hit lower mid-thigh on me, but you can kind of adjust the waistband the make the hem hit where you would like. I love the little metallic detail in the print. You can pair with sneakers or sandals for a casual day and then take the look from day tonight with some fun strappy gold heels!

Very vivid color and cute metallic detailing. It was cold that night, so I paired it with tights and knee high boots. As the other reviews say, the fit it a little strange, so I added a belt to bring more focus on the waist. Without the belt, it looked a little frumpy.

links_reviews_title: Love this dress! It is so pretty and picture doesn't do it justice. It was just too small.
links_reviews_text: Will definitely order again one size up.

Loved the color and the overall fit was cute. I couldn't quite figure out the internal lining of the top. If buttoned, it looked like it had multiple random keyhole openings. If unbuttoned, I had to keep rearranging the shoulders. Still a good rental tho!
Rented for vacation trip. Very versatile daytime dress: wore to a museum one day and an upscale vineyard restaurant another. Lots of compliments

links_reviews_title: I so wanted to love this....
links_reviews_text: I wanted to love this dress. I'd waited for it to be available and I lucked out when it I was able to reserve the day before I left on vacation. I never wore it. The fabric is beautiful. But the slip underneath is AWKWARD. It wasn't flattering at all overall and I felt that it was way too revealing between the buttons. Disappointed that it wasn't a match for me.

Everything from this designer fits so well. I wish I had taken a photo, I wore it to work and then again to brunch. One of my favorite rentals. I wasn't sure if the metallic threading would be too dressy, but it is great for work it could easily be worn to a wedding.
I've worn this before and it always gets compliments!
Wore a couple of times. Great fit, comfy, easy to dress up or down. Perfect seasonal transition piece! Would recommend and will probably rent again
Was too big up top and I'm the waist

links_reviews_title: Beautiful Dress, got lots of compliments
links_reviews_text: Loose fitting all around so fit is flexible
the buttons at the top don't fully close the top, so too revealing for work. also might have added heft to the hip area.

links_reviews_title: This dress is so great!! Got so many compliments!
links_reviews_text: Fits great and works for work and outside of work
Has an Indian vibe, feminine with great movement. Lots of compliments

links_reviews_title: Cute and not crazy about it
links_reviews_text: I wore this to a daytime event and brunch with my family. They complimented it but imo it wasn't a "wow" dress. Fit TTS

I'm a size 4-6 and got the size 1; I should have sized up for this more blousy style. It was a little small on my hips so it rode up and was not as loose across my size D chest as would have looked best. This style is best for a small frame, good legs. I loved the fabric print and how it fell, and it was a quality item with a good lining. Still, not the most flattering style for me. Pretty short, too.
too loose on top.
This dress fits nicely but at 5'7 was definitely too short for work.

links_reviews_title: No too flattering for a curvy body.
links_reviews_text: This dress was super short and the elastic waste made my mommy tummy look prego. It is a cute dress and would look amazing on a smaller frame but, I wouldn't recommend if you are curvy with a booty and thick thighs.
Felt like a Dolly Parton wannabe.

Like the other reviews mentioned, I did have to pin the top closed because it gapped between the buttons slightly, but the smocking at the waist made this really flattering. The sparkling thread also made it festive and fun. I wore this to a party and got a tone of compliments and felt very comfortable in it.

links_reviews_title: Very nice but likely best for slimmer shoulders/smaller chested women
links_reviews_text: Beautiful fabric with a great pop of metallic that's hard to see online. Buttons gapped slightly on me even though the dress otherwise fit- could likely fix with double sided tape but I didn't want to deal with the hassle for a casual event. Lightweight for summer/spring.

I wore this dress while out and about and it's a great dress, I just felt like the fit was a little weird up top. I had to use fashion tape to keep the top buttons intact so that it wouldn't keep coming open.
Didn't love this dress, it fits awkwardly, is rather difficult to get on/button, and the fabric seems rather dated in person. It is also rather short (I'm 5'6). Unfortunately I didn't wear this.

If any of you watch Archer you know I laughed ridiculously hard about these being "ocelot print". These pants were fun for work, but the waist was a little tight so they were not comfortable to sit in at my desk. If I rented them again I would go up one size.
Super, super cute!! I accented with burgundy short boots
If you like the concept of high-waisted ocelot Jeans (I do!!!!), these are for you. A tad snug at the waist for sitting but otherwise perfect for any animal-print friendly occasion.

links_reviews_title: Fun leopard print for a night out.
links_reviews_text: Fit was flattering , but a little baggy in the knees.

links_reviews_title: Love the look and the feel of these!
links_reviews_text: Liked the high waist on these, and the length. They had a slight "give" to them. I wore with loafers but could easily dress up with a bootie or heels.
The pants are fun and made of a light jean-like material. They look good dressed up or down!

links_reviews_title: Weird fit - high waist, big legs, short
links_reviews_text: Unusual cut - high waist, big through the legs, short (ankle length). I like the print and color, neutral and easy to wear. Denim and the loose-fitting legs makes it look very casual.

I usually wear size 10 jeans, but having an extra curvy season and considering these jeans are over 90% cotton (meaning less stretch) I sized up. Good move - they fit me perfectly. The print and cut aren't the most flattering on my shape but whatever. These run short on me at 6' as expected; hem seems very slightly bootcut. Nice quality textile and a fun print - would order again in the same size.

links_reviews_title: the most compliments ever - sassy pants
links_reviews_text: Loved the high waist, the print, and the fit. So many compliments. I wore these to work one day, on a date another day, and dressed them up for a fancy dinner another day. Incredibly versatile. I'm so in love with this brand.
I don't agree with the other reviews, these fit great! I love the high waist and structured feel, and if the price was lower, definitely would have purchased them.

I was hesitant to rent these jeans because a lot of the reviews said they were baggy....however I loved the pattern so I wanted to give it a try. I was gladly shocked at how well they fit. They were not baggy at all and actually made my legs looks super good

links_reviews_title: They were too short on me
links_reviews_text: So cute but too short for my long legs

When I unpacked them I thought they might be too big - I'm usually a 26 but in La Vie I am sometimes a 25 (also in Jcrew & Madewell). But they are thick and not super stretchy so the fit is right. Maybe more faded than I anticipated? But maybe that will maybe them more subtle.
Flattering, comfortable and high waisted awesomeness. I love the muted leopard print!
These have no stretch but seem true to size. High quality fabric that did not stretch out over the course of the day.
These jeans fit fine but are short on me so probably not great for tall gals. They have a cute pattern, but the cut and quality are unremarkable. Just ok overall.

links_reviews_title: Stiff jean, runs small, hard to style
links_reviews_text: So glad I sized up! I'm between a 24 and 25 and I could barely get the 25 over my bum. Once on they fit fine. But the material is thick and stiff, big mistake for the tail end of spring going into summer. Also hard to style and very long on me, had to roll the hem under 1-2 inches

These pants were a hit and perfect for the concert I wore them to. They are high-waisted which I wasn't confident about from viewing the picture but unfortunately have ZERO stretch so make sure you get the sizing right.
These didn't fit, I didn't love the fabric, I didn't wear them.
fit great - just fun jeans - got a few compliments - wore twice - will rent again
I love these! Fit me well. Look good!
Such a cute pair of pants. Got so many compliments -- had to roll them cause the length didn't work perfectly on my little legs but loved these
I loved these pants! They fit great. I am 6'1 so obviously they were super high waters but everything else was a dream. Wished I had more places to wear leopard spot jeans.

links_reviews_title: I usually don't wear animal type prints but these jeans were fun to wear.
links_reviews_text: The jeans were a very good fit except for the length. They were a little too long for me. The material is heavy so they are really good to wear in cooler weather. Overall, really liked these jeans.

links_reviews_title: Love most animal print fabric, so these made me happy.
links_reviews_text: Cute high-waisted animal print pants. The sizing was right on. I plan to wear these with something light pink.

links_reviews_title: Fun pants! The waist was a bit tight compared to the length of the legs.
links_reviews_text: Jean material

links_reviews_title: I wore this for several casual dinners and to a low-key work day.
links_reviews_text: relaxed fit throughout - a little snug at the waist where it buttoned, but that may just be my body shape. Lots of compliments on the fun print.
They aren't skinny, slim fitting jeans. Wore them to work since they are more structured like pants

links_reviews_title: A fun pair of jeans I would've never bought!
links_reviews_text: It's so hard to find jeans that fit, so I wasn't hopeful these would, but I was pleasantly surprised. They fit me like the proverbial glove. Other reviews had said the material was too stiff, but I didn't think so at all. I wore them with a black moto jacket and felt about as fashion forward as I ever get. My only concern was the length. They seemed a little too long for ankle length but not long enough not to be. No doubt a function of my height. At 5'5" I'm between petite and misses sizes.
definitely a little snug in the waist but generally true to size- really fun. wore 2x!

links_reviews_title: Such a fun but wearable piece!
links_reviews_text: Wore this with a black sweater & booties to work and got lots of compliments!

links_reviews_title: They were ok pants. I wouldn't not buy those but fun to wear.
links_reviews_text: they fit good

links_reviews_title: Day to day wear would be great if you have a very slim waist.
links_reviews_text: these fit everywhere but the waist. I should have paid attention to the other reviews.
Size not true!

I was afraid these would be too small, and they were, which bummed me out because they look awesome. They are very thick material, the design is fantastic - subdued peachy/pink background with light brown and gray spots - would go with so many things. No stretch whatsover. Smaller in the waist but more forgiving in the thighs. I may try these again when I lose this holiday pooch. Great pants for right body type.
Very high waist fit, but I liked that. Good length. Heavy-ish denim material with not a ton of stretch. Super easy to wear, I wore them twice. Fun pants!
As other reviews noted, these pants are hard to wear, and not very flattering.

links_reviews_title: Great fitting, comfortable and on trend.
links_reviews_text: Cute print with a great fit. Just enough stretch so they hold their shape and are super comfortable.
Not a tight/skinny fit.....loose at the ankles......still cute!

links_reviews_title: Great with a leather jacket and sneakers.
links_reviews_text: I wanted to love these pants, but if your 5' 4" or shorter, prepare for an extremely long length. I just folded them under and then cuffed them. That worked just fine. Didn't LOVE them but didn't hate them either.

links_reviews_title: Comfortable fit and great pop of color
links_reviews_text: I wore this jacket to a musical and it was appropriate and comfortable. The collar was a lovely detail. The color is a little red-orange and not a true red. The jacket was long and had a boyfriend fit.

This jacket is great for a holiday season. The color is more of an orange red than red. I ordered larger, because my shoulders are pretty broad in my opinion. I think an 18, and maybe even the 16 would have fit better. The length was great, nice and long (I'm 5'10). Material is great and construction felt nice.

links_reviews_title: Great color, fun jacket. Fit is a bit boxy
links_reviews_text: Wore with white jeans to work for casual Summer look. The pop of color was great, jacket is a bit boxy and sleeves are a bit short so fit wasn't perfect for me, but a fun rental.

I definitely felt like a sophisticated boss babe in this blazer. I had some for important appointments at a prestigeous university and this blazer is a total confidence booster!! First well, material is incredible and overall good look.

links_reviews_title: Fun pop of color to liven up my work wardrobe!
links_reviews_text: Will definitely rent again!
Definitely boxy like the other reviewers wrote, but fun to dress up basic black for something new.

links_reviews_title: The color and neckline are amazing!!
links_reviews_text: The fit is a little loose but I will definitely be renting again to wear as a statement piece to work! Can also be dressed down for a night out.
Got a lot of compliments on this cut and color! Has pockets too.

Great material. Clearly high quality. Hidden pockets are deep and very functional. Notch collar is a favorite detail. Sleeves a touch long, but I was worried a size down would have been too small. Perfect fit in the shoulders. Gorgeous persimmon color.

links_reviews_title: Love the red! Would rent again.
links_reviews_text: Would definitely rent again

links_reviews_title: Runs a little large but great quality and cut!
links_reviews_text: I previously rented this same jacket in purple in a size 12 and LOVED it. But this jacket wasn't available in a 12, so I rented a 14 instead. I knew it would be bigger but I think that it is still slightly oversized. I would definitely rent this again in a 12--I almost bought the purple one I'd previously rented, and if I rent this red blazer in the right size I'm not sure I'll be able to return it!! Insta: @whatirented

links_reviews_title: Fun blazer for Spring or Summer!
links_reviews_text: Chic and modern blazer with a gorgeous vibrant red color. I stuck true to size and it worked great. Might run a smidge on the larger size.

links_reviews_title: Makes a summer look pulled together
links_reviews_text: Perfect for top layer for a Chicago summer day. Lots of compliments, super comfortable and high quality. Highly recommend

The color is really pretty and I got a lot of compliments! It has nice hidden pockets too. I wasn't sure if I was going to like the collar but it gives it a dressed down vibe. Nice quality fabric (I got it new). I mostly wore with jeans. I got a 4 and my hips are really a 6 but there are no buttons and it looked fine open. I would rent again.
It's a bit shapeless (I prefer a more fitted jacket).
The color is amazing, got so many compliments
Runs slightly big, should have ordered the 8 for a better fit!
Just great. Easy to wear, good material quality, awesome color. The best!
for broad shoulders and a much longer torso
The color was very pretty but the cut and length felt very matronly on me.

links_reviews_title: Great work blazer but runs large.
links_reviews_text: This blazer is a sharp orange red and tailored but a little long. If you're short like me, you'll want to wear this with heels. I normally wear a size 4 or 6 in tops but should have gone with a size 4 in this blazer since it's not designed to clasp at the waist.
Ordered a few sizes up, but loved the collar

This blazer is heftier than it looks on the model - fully lined and had a pleasant weight that created good drape. Wore it over a black halter top black tuxedo jumpsuit to brighten my look for a daytime ceremony-nighttime reception wedding. As a petite person, I found the sleeves a scotch long for my purposes and ended up rolling them up a bit.
Runs a little long for a petite girl like me, but it was fine when I folded the sleeves up.

links_reviews_title: More orange red than true red
links_reviews_text: Super cute. If you're between sizes size down
Great basic red blazer with subtle details around the neck. Great for work and easy to match with other pieces.

links_reviews_title: Wore for a more formal work day and got so many compliments!
links_reviews_text: Love the dress! Shows all the bumps but a fantastic dress.
Didn't love the material and fit was bigger than I expected
Ran a bit large, but has a great cut and the color was fabulous. Recommend.
The color was fantastic and cut as well. A great length. Only bummer was the sleeves were a little short and couldn't be flipped up as there wasn't anything special with interior lining
Too large and material is thick and heavy.

links_reviews_title: The color was a little orange for me. I like a cooler red. Warm reds are not good for my skin tone.
links_reviews_text: The fit was good did not like the color
It does fit a big large, but it is very comfortable and fully lined with actually usable pockets. I received several compliments on it and would wear again.
Sleeves were too long and boxy fit. Surprising for a size 0

links_reviews_title: A very, very bright splash of color.
links_reviews_text: I got a ton of compliments at the office when I wore this. In truth, it was almost too bright for me. Nice cut, flattering fit, very versatile for work or play. I think the material feels a little cheap for the price-tag but overall no complaints.
This jacket fit well, didn't get to hot on me and looked great with nice jeans for a dressier casual look at work.

links_reviews_title: Very heavy fabric and loose cut combine to make this pretty unflattering...
links_reviews_text: See title
ran a little large. pretty color
I didn't wear this blazer. It's very wide in stomach area and kind of a weird fit.

I love this blazer, it completes an outfit. I wore this as a jacket with jeans, leggings and dress pants. It works well with all. The only thing is it is getting worn and it has some pulling and the lining in the right sleeve is torn. I would have bought it if it was in better shape.
Super sophisticated - felt like a true scholar in this one. Great for winter. Definitely runs large. I normally wear a small, but I got an XS and still was able to wear a sweater underneath
Very flattering, perfect fit. Thick and warm, so did best worn with tank and leggings. As a blazer over a dress for work was too hot even in winter cold temps.
I sized down based on reviews but it was small across the shoulders. If you are curvy, get your regular size. Will try to rent again
Enjoyed this blazer because it was a bit on the longer size. Wore it with both jeans and a skirt for work and looked great.
Great slightly oversized fit was great for work.

links_reviews_title: Thick and comfortable, but on the large side
links_reviews_text: Beautifully made blazer and perfect for fall / winter, but definitely runs large. Case in point: I wore this 26 weeks pregnant and was actually able to button it. The sleeves were a bit long as well. Got tons of compliments and felt great wearing it.
Runs very big- go at least one size down

I am 190 lbs, 5'5 tall and wear bra size 38DD. The fit was great and actually fit over my broad shoulders nicely. I live in South Carolina and there is no way I could wear this anywhere at any time during the year because it is so thick.

I received a lot of compliments every time I wore this jacket. Perfect for fall/winter. Heavy material. It is a little boxy and a little big. I think a medium may have fit just fine. Would definitely rent again.

This jacket runs quite large. I normally wear S/M and the S was too big. Very warm and good quality, just too large. I wore it a few times to the office on very cold days to try and make it work but you could tell it didn't fit and the shoulders were too broad.

links_reviews_title: This was a great blazer for the office - especially mine, which is freezing!
links_reviews_text: This is heavy weight, very warm - great for a chilly fall day. Note: there is a white thread pulled on the lapel.

Was planning to wear it as a jacket, but left it on all day and most folks just thought it was a sportcoat. Got lots of compliments on it, but also a lot of "why do you look so fancy today?" Definitely a once-in-a-while item, as most people don't view it as an everyday jacket.

links_reviews_title: Very heavy fabric and runs small
links_reviews_text: This jacket would suffice for chilly Fall mornings as it's very thick and heavy fabric. The only downside for me was I was unable to button (by a lot) the XL as I'm a size 14/16 and I believe the XL fits like a 12. This is fine to wear it like the model and open.
Runs a bit small. Cute details, but was a bit stiff when I received it. The fur at the top didn't look the freshest. Looks cute with lots of outfits!

links_reviews_title: It was great for a horseback ride in Arizona
links_reviews_text: The jacket is very stiff. I tossed in the dryer with dryer balls thinking it may loosen it up, it didn't.
Totally love the look of this jacket and the fit is nice but it is very stiff. There is no give. I would rent it again in a larger size so I could move my arms better. But a super stylish look!
I really liked this denim jacket because it added something different with the fur and metal studs! It fit true to size, but was pretty stiff I guess because it hasn't been broken in.
Can fit a chunky sweater under. Came with a few creases in it but I'm sure an iron will straighten it out. Sleeves are long enough! I'm 5'8 and 125lbs.
Loved this jacket. The sleeves were a little short on my long arms but I rolled them up to make it less noticeable.

As other reviews have mentioned, the lightweight-ness / thinness of the denim is a bit surprising, but the look it achieves is great! The jacket easily elevates casual wear, especially in the cooler months. Wish I had it back in my closet!
Very very cute. Worked super well for going out at night and during the day. It's a bit stiff but started softening after I wore it a while so maybe it'll keep getting softer as it breaks in

links_reviews_title: Such a staple item in the wardrobe!
links_reviews_text: It's perfect for weather transition, not too cold and not too warm to wear. Even though it was a little cropped, it still covered my whole torso.

Very cute. I'm just discovering that jean jackets are a little stiff and maybe jean jackets just aren't my thing. However, it went well with several outfits. Makes for a mean Canadian Tuxedo. Note it is not fully lined, just the collar. It's still a fairly warm jacket.
Loved wearing it around, goes great with sweaters and t shirts.. however, it seems to run a little small for the size.
Part of me is so sad I returned this, perfect for city life. Warm and stylish.
was comfortable and not too hot
Great for wknd! Only complaint is the stiffness of the jacket which I think is due to the dry cleaning so not much can be done about that. But loved and got compliments!
I would rent again
Excellent quality and fit

definitely cute and a better quality/thicker denim than i expected. the little gems things are cuter in person too! only downside is it does run a little small, especially in the arms (not length but is snug in the shoulders so you couldn't wear anything heavy underneath). i would say to size up regardless but if you wanted an oversized fit, size up two sizes!
Love the fit and the silver stud details. Was great for everyday wear.

links_reviews_title: I want this Jacket! I am thinking of buying it.
links_reviews_text: Awesome! I got a lot of complements.

links_reviews_title: Cute and stylish but stiff and too hard to button.
links_reviews_text: This is a really cute piece. The medium was too wide in the waist for my hourglass figure. My issue is the fabric was so stiff that when it came the bottom had wrinkled in deep-set wrinkles that I didn't even attempt to iron out. Also it was tough to button and I realized I'd rather return it same day than deal. It's a shame cause with the collar and the cute detailing in the back could have been a trendy piece to wear.

links_reviews_title: The material was too stiff to wear
links_reviews_text: Never wore it!
Fun take on a denim jacket. Not stretchy so size up if in between sizes. Really liked and received lots of compliments.
Was a little stiff but cute - only wore once.
Wore this jacket to a baseball game and it was perfect!
Good jacket for traveling in. I ordered a size up, and I'm glad I did because it is NOT an oversize fit

links_reviews_title: Cute jean jacket, with stud details
links_reviews_text: Probably should've gone a size up - it was very stiff and didn't have much room in this.

This Jean jacket was just fine. The fit was a little off in that the body of it was large in the middle and smaller on the bottom waistband. I also thought the shearling went all the way through - but it's just on the collar so not as warm as I thought I was getting. The studded detailing was nice!
Loved it- just as described. Wish I bought it!
fits small but loved the way it looks! I would recommend sizing up! good for a tank or t-shirt underneath!
Order up if you plan on wearing a sweater underneath. This jacket is so cute and goes with everything!
Love this! Keeping it for as long as possible!
This isn't really my normal style so it was really fun to mix it up!
I like a bigger fit in outerwear and so I got the L and it fit great (5'10 and 160).

links_reviews_title: An edgy take on a basic jean jacket
links_reviews_text: The studs add extra flair. The jean fabric was a little stiff

I have been looking for a denim jacket with a sherpa collar but have been nervous about buying one. I was excited to find this available! I loved the fit - I have narrow shoulders and the small worked perfectly for me. I did feel like the fabric was really stiff (that could have been the starch when it was cleaned), but once I wore it for a few hours it felt better. Didn't feel like the best quality of denim, which shocked me considering the retail price! I didn't notice the studs online and was a little unsure when I got it, and it's a lighter denim than I would normally prefer, but I turned out really liking the style. Overall, it was a good, comfy jacket and great for layering.
Was a little tight on the shoulders.
Fits snug, get a larger size if you want to put it over a sweater

links_reviews_title: Love the little details with the rivets and was perfect for layering!
links_reviews_text: Love the jacket but the only issue was the denim smelt a little cheap. For a high end jacket, I wasnt impressed with the denim quality.

Very cute jacket! I sized up to a medium (normally a small) and I'm glad I did! The fabric is pretty stiff. This is a fitted style jacket, if you want to wear a sweater or anything thicker underneath I would size up.
I didn't realize this had studs on it :( for me this was too "young" looking. I returned, which was sad. The fur was nice. I can't say it looked/felt like a $300 jacket though.

links_reviews_title: Runs very large, but amazing piece!!
links_reviews_text: I have rented this coat over and over again. A fun athletic and trendy twist on an every day spring rain coat. Runs very large!

SIZE DOWN. I got a medium. I normally wear a large/XL and the medium fit perfectly. I wore it in snowy Chicago and walked around the city all day. With this coat, a hat, gloves, and a scarf I was fully cozy. It was like 30 degrees. Plenty of pockets. Great. Would rent again.
Took to Italy in late November. Great weight. Went with everything. It does run large. I usually wear a medium, but the small was plenty big.

links_reviews_title: One rental, four countries! The perfect travel companion!
links_reviews_text: This was the absolute perfect jacket for an early spring European vacation when the weather ranged from 40 and rainy to 65 and sunny--in the same day! It covered four countries with ease. Although the pics are casual, I was able to dress it up too. The jacket was also easy to pack or carry. As many have said, it does run a bit large as you can see in some of the pics and it's quite voluminous if you don't use the drawstring waist which is tucked inside of the coat. The many zippered pockets also came in handy and gave me easy access to things like cellphone, passport and museum passes--the Swiss Army knife of jackets! Extremely well-made. Loved it!

links_reviews_title: Literally the best thing I've ever rented
links_reviews_text: Literally one of the best things I've ever rented. I love the full-length bomber jacket look. I rented this for a trip to Europe. It worked wonders to protect me from pouring rain and cold weather in a variety of countries. I love zippers! And this jacket does not disappoint.
This jacket was so big and made me look very large. I didn't wear it anywhere and wouldn't recommend!
I got this jacket for my vacation and it was a definitely a head turner :) I am 5'2" and busty so the front view is not as flattering as the side profile view

links_reviews_title: Quality piece but huge and difficult to style
links_reviews_text: I sized down after reading other reviews, and it was still gigantic - just a ton of material. Cinching the waist and hem cords helped to give it a little shape, but with the coat zipped all the way up and cords cinched, I couldn't take normal strides! It was heavy and seemed very warm, but it just didn't work for me. The knit sleeves were quite tight and definitely could not wear long sleeves underneath. Wore it once, felt ridiculous, and sent it back.

The jacket is roomy but I didn’t find it insanely oversized the way some other people described it - there’s a waist elastic (adjustment tabs are on the inside of the coat) which were super cinched when it arrived and I was actually surprised how fitted it was. I don’t prefer an hourglass-shaped jacket so I let those out which results in a straighter and more voluminous shape which I found on-trend. I do like to wear a jacket unbuttoned and it’s fairly swingy when it’s not zipped up, but I also liked it zipped. Very high quality, the finish of the fabric is a bit satiny. Four zip pockets are super great for holding everything. A small quibble is that I didin’t love the zipper - a little chunky and rough, and double zippers are so needlessly difficult to hold together to start the zip (who really finds it that useful to be able to unzip a coat from the bottom?). In terms of the weight, I would characterize this as not a winter coat but pretty good for nearly winter. I thought it might be a bit warmer and ordered it to try in late New York winter (early March), and luckily the temperatures turned a bit warmer when I had it. It’s great for like 40s and 50s, but much colder than high 30s it would not be warm enough unless maybe you layered a lot (which certainly there is room in the coat to do). In terms of layering also note that the cuffs, which are the whole forearm really, are quite tight, so you may have trouble wearing a really bulky sweater underneath because of this, especially if it’s one with a thick folded cuff.
Chic bomber. That's all I have to say. So many things right with this. Cool & edgy and I kept for a long time!
Warm, sleek, elegant & fashionable twist on a black bomber jacket. Very figure flattering!
I rented this coat for a European vacation in October. It was great for the weather and went with everything. It runs a little big. Even the XS was a bit wide in the shoulders.
Loved this jacket and will rent again! It is comfortable and thicker material. I wore it traveling and in 30 degree weather and was warm. Perfect length for taller girls.

Exactly what Unlimited is for - to wear something that you otherwise never would. This coat was everything - stylish, comfortable, well made and expensive!!! Listened to reviews and sized down. The small was still big but the cinched waist made it look adorable. Paired with tights and ankle boots to keep it slimmer on bottom. EVERYWHERE I went, people commented on it. Longest I've ever kept a rental. Rent it before the warm weather comes!!

Just what I wanted! Lightweight, packable, warm and stylish coat for travel. This coat will take me everywhere from airport to lunch and shopping to dinner and a play in style. One of my favorite rentals!
True to size in shoulders/sleeves. The rest looked like a joke. Unwearable. A shame as good quality.

When I first tried this on, i thought i looked crazy. I grew to enjoy it. It's pretty warm (i wore it in 20 degrees and it was just getting cold). It has a very distint, structured shape. My husband only noticed the zippers.
Super large when weating a small ... love it love it
The fabric was warm, was good for NYC winter (except the low collar / no hood)
Runs big. Size down. Loved the fit.

I’m generally an xxs-xs, but I rented a small so my partner could wear this also. It’s not her style and at first I found it a bit large, but I cinched the inside and actually found it quite cute. It’s meant to be oversized, that’s the style. I have a pretty alt style and loved it a lot. Wore it over a lot of Maison Margiela style tops and looser fitting pants. Might buy.

I loved this oversized bomber style coat ! It is an oversized design so initially got the small and sent it back for the XS, which was a much better fit. It is very lightweight so it was perfect for the fall transition but offers no warmth once the temp drops. I am tall and it was down to my knees so , if you are petite , you may swim in it. One of my favorite rentals.

links_reviews_title: Great travel coat for mild climates - Size down
links_reviews_text: Agree with what everyone else says. I'm an XL/L coat normally and ended up swapping the L out for the M. Definitely more flattering from a side view than front on. Wearing this on an upcoming trip to London and will continue to rent in the future!

I felt v. cool in this jacket. It runs oversize and the sleeves are big (on purpose) so it's a bit hard to carry a backpack. It's also not quite as warm as I thought it would be bet - and because it's so big air gets up from the bottom. So I recommend sizing down and renting for 55-65 degree weather.
I wanted to love this jacket. It was giant for a Medium and the proportions are weird.
I was surprised how much I liked this coat - it's oversized & comfortable. I also wore it in temps from 10 to 60, it's a great transition piece.
